12:00.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De Dodville
runners.comment: Well beaten in novices at Newbury and Kempton; looks one for handicaps after this
runners.name: Hove Ranger
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and well beaten in 1m novices at Newbury (soft) and Kempton (Polytrack); looks one for handicaps after this.

runners.comment: Placed in three of his four starts; sets a fair standard; blinkers replace cheekpieces
runners.name: Marseillan
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of his four starts, the latest when beaten half a length on nursery debut at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) 13 days ago; blinkers replace the cheekpieces he wore then and he sets a fair standard.

runners.comment: Ran well on penultimate start and may have had excuses last time; each-way claims
runners.name: Ten Cuidado
runners.spotlight: Fourth of nine on his Wolverhampton reappearance (7f, Tapeta) last month (first two have won since), but well held back there 16 days ago (took a keen hold and lost a shoe); each-way claims if bouncing back.

runners.comment: Beaten a neck in a slowly run race over 1m here a fortnight ago; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Wind Summer
runners.spotlight: Improved for the step up in trip when beaten a neck into second of five here (1m) a fortnight ago; that race was steadily run, but at least he seems to be going the right way; cheekpieces are given a go.

runners.comment: Caught the eye when 3rd on his Wolverhampton debut last month; the longer trip should suit
runners.name: Eternitys Sunrise
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye when a staying-on third of 13 on his Wolverhampton debut (6f, Tapeta) last month; the form of that race hasn't worked out, but he is open to improvement and the longer trip should suit.

runners.comment: Little to shout about in his first two starts; modest handicaps beckon
runners.name: High Boltage
runners.spotlight: Big prices and little to shout about in his first two starts at Newbury (6.5f, good) and Kempton (1m, Polytrack); modest handicaps beckon.

runners.comment: Beat one home on his Kempton debut; probably needs more time
runners.name: Savvi Row
runners.spotlight: 18-1 when beating one home on his Kempton debut (6f, Polytrack) four weeks ago; probably needs more time.

runners.comment: Well held on her Kempton debut; handicaps over further are likely to be her thing
runners.name: La Kosmos
runners.spotlight: 33-1 when a well-held sixth of nine on her Kempton debut (7f, Polytrack) three weeks ago; handicaps over further are likely to be her thing in due course.

runners.comment: Well held in both starts, but she was well backed over C&D last time; watch the market
runners.name: Poetic Grace
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in both starts, albeit the first was in a Newmarket sales race while she was sent off just 11-4 for a similar contest to this over C&D next time; interesting to see if the money arrives for her again.

runners.comment: Promise on her Kempton debut but pulled too hard here last time; hood on; shortlisted
runners.name: Sweep In Time
runners.spotlight: Both starts over 1m on Polytrack, showing promise when fifth of 13 on her Kempton debut in October but taking too keen a hold here four weeks ago; shortlisted if settling better in the first-time hood.

12:30.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Fourth of ten on his Southwell debut; could make an impact if coping with the drop in trip
runners.name: Alpine Culture
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred gelding who was sent off 10-1 for this month's Southwell debut (7f, Tapeta) and ran well for a long way before fading to finish fourth of ten; should be better for the run and could make an impact if coping with the drop in trip.

runners.comment: Market support would be significant as this doesn't look a deep race
runners.name: Grey Force
runners.spotlight: February foal by Blue Point; first foal; dam 5f-7f winner (including 2yo Listed), half-sister to 5f Listed winner Logo Hunter, out of useful 5f 2yo winner; market support would be significant as this doesn't look a deep race.

runners.comment: 4l behind Alpine Culture when fifth on his Southwell debut; needs to settle better
runners.name: Wild Act
runners.spotlight: Sent off 6-1 when fifth of ten on his Southwell debut (7f, Tapeta) 19 days ago, pulling too hard and finishing 4l behind Alpine Culture; bred to be much better than that, but he does have a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Something to like on pedigree and market should be revealing
runners.name: Anaba Girl
runners.spotlight: May foal by Mayson; sister to 6f-1m winner Stone Soldier (including 2yo/AW; RPR 106), half-sister to winners L'Addition (6f AW 2yo; 70) and Duchess of Fife (1m; 69); dam 7f 2yo winner (93), half-sister to 1m2f Listed winner Princess Loulou; something to like on pedigree and the market should be revealing.

runners.comment: Out of the frame in her first two starts but probably has a bigger effort in her
runners.name: Cryingintherain
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in her first two starts, but was sent off just 2-1 each time and she certainly didn't enjoy the ideal trip here (5f) a fortnight ago; probably has a bigger effort in her; stable also runs No Drama Mama.

runners.breeder: Mrs S M Rogers & Sir Thomas Pilkington
runners.comment: Clear of the third when second of five over C&D 16 days ago; sets a fair standard
runners.name: Hen Party
runners.spotlight: Placed in her last three starts, finishing clear of the third when second of five over C&D 16 days ago; sets a fair standard and has every chance of going on better under Oisin Murphy.

runners.comment: Ninth on her Southwell debut; hood on, but stable may field a stronger candidate elsewhere
runners.name: No Drama Mama
runners.spotlight: 160,000gns yearling; 40-1 when ninth of 14 on her Southwell debut (7f, Tapeta) 12 days ago; hood now given a go, but the stable may field a stronger candidate in Cryingintherain.

13:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Nursery Handicap

runners.comment: Beat Akabusi by a head over C&D last time; 2lb worse off but won with a little bit in hand
runners.name: Lord Harcourt
runners.spotlight: First start since gelded when beating Akabusi by a head over C&D this month (third has won since); 2lb worse off, but he did well to come from so far back and appeared to win with a little bit in hand; highly respected.

runners.comment: Beaten a head by Lord Harcourt over C&D last time and 2lb better off; a player
runners.name: Akabusi

quotes.race: PricedUp Daily Sports Boosts Nursery Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Nursery Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried as I could see them adjusting the saddle behind the stalls and Hollie [Doyle, jockey] was out of sight, so for a second I thought Akabusi was going to be a non-runner. Hollie said he was going down to post beautifully, but then he just jinked to the side and she came off, and he kicked her in the leg as she went down. We always felt that once he'd been gelded he'd put his best feet forward. He's sharpened up at home and is starting to show it on the track too - Michael Keady, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner on turf/Tapeta who was beaten a head by Lord Harcourt over C&D earlier this month; 2lb better off, but he did appear to enjoy the run of the race and is more exposed than the winner; a player all the same.

runners.comment: 3-4 in nurseries, the last two wins at Newcastle; this is a totally different type of test
runners.name: Up The Agenda
runners.spotlight: 3-4 in nurseries, his only defeat coming in cheekpieces on heavy ground; last two wins have come in four-runner contests at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) and this different test poses as much of a question as the 4lb rise.

runners.comment: Looked a bit unfortunate at Kempton on penultimate start, but ran poorly last time
runners.name: Alasrae

prev_owners.owner: J Hall, A Haynes And Partners

runners.spotlight: May have been unfortunate not to win a novice at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) at the start of the month, but he ran poorly when sent off favourite at Southwell (5f, Tapeta) last time; needs to bounce back; stable also runs Fermain.

runners.comment: Has failed to beat a rival in last two starts, the latest over C&D; best watched for now
runners.name: Fermain
runners.spotlight: Made all and just held on to win a Leicester novice (6f, soft) in October, but has failed to beat a rival in either start since including when behind two of these over C&D last time; best watched for now.

runners.comment: Won over 6f at Kempton, but didn't stay 7f there last time; each-way claims back in trip
runners.name: Mighty Vega
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & Lds Bloodstock
runners.spotlight: Narrowly off the mark on his reappearance in a Kempton novice (6f, Polytrack) last month, but seemed not to stay 7f on nursery debut there three weeks ago; each-way claims back in trip.

runners.comment: Relatively exposed and needs to improve for the visor back from three months off
runners.name: Guernsey Lady
runners.spotlight: Patchy form since winning a turf novice here (5f, good) in May; return to 6f may suit, but she is relatively exposed and needs to improve for the visor back from three months off.

13:30.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who bids for a four-timer from a 4lb higher mark; much respected
runners.name: Clearpoint

quotes.race: Jenningsbet EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Clearpoint just didn't scope as I wanted before Ascot, but he's a pretty smart horse and we like him a lot. He's got a great mind, he's a very talented horse and he'll go to the July Stakes now. I just wanted to get another run into him - I didn't work him this week, I ran him instead. To be honest I think he's a star - a future star, one of the few - Richard Fahey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Established trailblazer who bids for a four-timer from a 4lb higher mark (first two wins came over C&D); may face competition up front from Almaty Star, but he didn't lead when winning here last month so being able to dominate isn't a necessity; much respected.

runners.comment: Has something to prove over this sharper 5f and is 0-28 off marks in the 90s
runners.name: Baldomero
runners.spotlight: Usually seen over further but is 2-6 over the minimum trip including when successful in a 0-105 at Wolverhampton (Tapeta) 11 days ago; whether he will be able to lay up over this sharper 5f in a strongly run race is open to doubt, though, while he is 0-28 off marks in the 90s.

stable_tour.quote: He's won over £200,000 in prize-money since we bought him. His latest win was at Doncaster this month and he just loves soft ground on the grass. He's very effective on the all-weather as well. He's only won three times but he's always consistent and in the money a lot in good races. He'll probably go for next month's Coral Sprint Trophy at York providing the ground is soft. 26-09-24

runners.comment: Continues to slide down the weights but losing run now 18 and this test could be too sharp
runners.name: Twilight Jet

prev_owners.owner: Michael Iavarone & Julia Iavarone & Michael Ocallaghan

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Abergwaun Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It's a very sharp five at Tipperary, hence the headgear, but it kept Twilight Jet concentrated. We'd lots of dreams and aspirations after he won the Lacken but  he was very sick after Ascot, then had colic surgery since and later slipped on a hard surface so needed surgery on his hock. This year was race to race so and he had a good blow afterwards. The headgear may stay on. He could go to Newbury or further afield in the coming months and may stay in training - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Lacken Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Twilight Jet doesn't know when to stop. He's a very good horse. He's as tough. He got better and quicker with every run. He went to the Breeders Cup and that might have been one race too many for him. He's come back bigger and stronger this year and even quicker I think. He's the real deal - Leigh Roche, jockey.

quotes.race: Newmarket Academy Godolphin Beacon Project Cornwallis Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: The plan was to make the running but we got a nice lead into it and the race couldn't have gone any better. Twilight Jet has plenty of speed and handled the drop back to five. He liked this ground but is quite versatile in that regard - Leigh Roche, rider.

runners.spotlight: Continues to slide down the weights and ran well when third of ten at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) four weeks ago, but that extended his losing run to 18 and this test could prove too sharp.

runners.comment: Ridden aggressively for all four wins, but being able to dominate here seems unlikely
runners.name: Fidelius
runners.spotlight: Has been ridden aggressively for his four wins (all on the AW) including at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) last month, but being able to dominate here seems unlikely; stable also runs Almaty Star.

runners.comment: C&D winner and usually a front-runner; 4lb lower than when last successful; could go well
runners.name: Almaty Star

quotes.race: Esprit Couture 1er Cru Handicap
quotes.quote: Almaty Star has been a bit of a revelation since dropping him back to five and using those forcing tactics. Ray has given him quite an intelligent ride. He stacked them up and got them all caught on heels - Robert Cowell, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Usually makes the running, though only two of his four wins have come from the front; has winning form over C&D and although 1lb higher than for this month's two Chelmsford placings, is still 4lb lower than when last successful; could go well.

runners.comment: Won a handicap over C&D last time, but that was off a mark of 92; this is a tougher test
runners.name: Dukes Command
runners.spotlight: Was up to this trip for the first time when winning a 0-105 handicap over C&D 16 days ago, but that was off a mark of 92 and this is a much tougher test.

runners.comment: Good form in two AW starts for the Gosdens; watch market on stable debut; visor on
runners.name: Military Academy

quotes.race: Slate Floodlit Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Military Academy started his career a little later than usual but has progressed with every start and is still learning. He's taken a step forward since Newmarket. He's got plenty of size and scope and hopefully he will mature over the winter for next year. He's run a few races in quick succession, so we'll leave him alone and bring him back next year - Thady Gosden, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two runs on the AW for the Gosdens resulted in a win in a Listed contest at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) in November last year and second of seven in the Group 3 Winter Derby at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) in February; poor in his last two starts on turf and makes his stable debut in a first-time visor having been picked up for 50,000gns in October; market revealing.

runners.comment: Lightly raced since winning twice as a 3yo; behind Tyrrhenian Sea at Kempton last time
runners.name: Torito

quotes.race: Betfred Lester Piggott Handicap
quotes.quote: They all get put in (the Derby) as yearlings so you can never read into a Derby entry as they are put in for 600GBP as a yearling, but I like Torito and we will see if we can go to Royal Ascot. He will get bumped up a few pounds for that but hopefully it won't be mad. He has handled the ground well and I'm very pleased - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's hard work on that ground and it's tough to get through that on the first run of the season. Torito got tired in the last half furlong but should come on for that. He might want stepping up in trip and to be ridden a bit more patiently. I think he'll be better on better ground - Robert Havlin, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since winning twice on turf as a 3yo; finished around 4l behind Tyrrhenian Sea when sixth of eight on AW debut at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) last month and although the return to this trip may suit, he will need to improve; stable also runs Nebras.

runners.comment: Won this in 2023 and second last year; should be all the better for last month's return
runners.name: Tyrrhenian Sea

quotes.race: BetMGM Tandridge Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It was a small field and we were keen to ride Tyrrhenian Sea a bit more prominently. We know he handles the track and he had a fitness edge over the favourite - Jack Mitchell, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: BetUK Quebec Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Tyrrhenian Sea has had good runs on the turf but the all-weather is definitely his game. Coming into the race he was in the form of his life. It took us a few steps to get going but I let him do his own thing and find his rhythm. I did the Lingfield manoeuvre, which was to try to get on the pace before it quickened and, as I did, it dropped coming into the straight and he hit the line well. We didn't have Lord North to deal with, but I don't see why he can't compete at Group level again - Jack Mitchell, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: A regular in races like this and he is running in this event for the third time having won it in 2023 and finished runner-up to Royal Champion last year; should be all the better for his return to action when third of eight in another Listed race at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) last month; solid.

stable_tour.quote: He's in the form of his life and is going to go for the Group 2 bet365 Mile at Sandown. We're excited to see what he can do on turf and how he performs at Sandown will dictate how we campaign him but it would be nice to get a bit of turf racing into him. 11-04-25

He won his first three starts and, although he hasn't added to that, he has run some good races in defeat. Of his two runs this year his second to Lord North in the Winter Derby was a fine effort. He has been enjoying a summer break and could have one run in the autumn before returning for a winter campaign over a mile to 1m2f. 25-08-23

runners.comment: This is tougher than the handicap he made all in last time, but he remains unexposed
runners.name: Nebras

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: John and Thady Gosden expected Nebras to finish second or third, so he's surprised us a bit. Whether he runs again this year we don't yet know - Teddy Grimthorpe, racing manager to the owner.

runners.spotlight: Was winning for the first time since his debut when making all and just holding on off a mark of 95 in a 0-105 handicap at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) last month; this is much tougher, but he remains unexposed and could go well especially if again left alone in front.

14:30.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: Drops back in grade and may well enjoy the run of the race; respected
runners.name: Invited

quotes.race: Bet MGM: It's Showtime Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was a nice spot for Invited today, and the race couldn't have gone any smoother for him - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Handy sort whose three successes have all come on the AW this year, the latest over 7f here in August, while his other two wins came over this trip elsewhere; held in both starts since the tongue-tie went on, but drops back in grade and may well enjoy the run of the race; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He looks progressive and he really appreciates a bit of time between his runs. His pedigree suggests his three-year-old career is what it's really about, so we might just wait and get him on the grass in the next month or so. 07-04-25

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but may need a stiffer test now; wouldn't want this to be run at a dawdle
runners.name: Hitched

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Vase Middle Distance Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Hitched has been a model of consistency all winter. That's his 15th run of the campaign, so he's pretty admirable, and I was delighted he was able to top it off with his best performance. Lingfield suits him best, it's just unfortunate there weren't many races there that fitted him. He probably should have been All-Weather Horse of the Year if I hadn't messed the last few runs up, but he's been a superstar. He's very sound with a great mind and he's a joy to train - David Simcock, trainer.

runners.spotlight: AW hat-trick in the autumn of last year included two wins over C&D, but both course victories since then have come over 1m2f; still on a fair mark if bouncing back from a lesser effort over that trip here nine days ago, but he wouldn't want this to be run at a dawdle.

runners.comment: Has gone the wrong way since his successful debut; best watched on stable debut
runners.name: Nordic Norm
runners.spotlight: Went the wrong way after his winning debut for Karl Burke at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) in February; makes his debut for his new yard after 82 days off having been picked up for 2,000gns in October; probably best watched.

stable_tour.quote: His form is working out well and we're aiming at the Listed Burradon Stakes on Good Friday. I thought we were going to be stepping up in trip but he seems to be getting faster with racing and I'm happy to stick at a mile for now. 11-04-25

runners.comment: Back off last winning mark but efforts since returned to the AW leave plenty to be desired
runners.name: Great Blasket

quotes.race: bettingsites.co.uk Betting Sites Handicap (Chepstow Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It was a stressful ride. I got locked down the rail and I thought a little bit of space would come but it didn't. Great Blasket has been tough today - I haven't even picked my stick up on him. I'm lucky the gaps came up late on and he went for me - Elizabeth Gale, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Follow Us On X @betrhino Handicap
quotes.quote: We'll check Great Blasket over tomorrow but as long as he comes out of the race okay I can't think why he wouldn't take his chance. He's a very hardy horse. He won first time for us and we probably didn't know how to ride him the next few times on the all-weather. Kieran Shoemark won on him at Southwell, where we said we'd drop him out and try to get there as late as possible, and since then he's won four from five. The change of tactics has definitely worked in his favour. I think stepping up to higher grade races suits him down to the ground, a harder pace and better quality of horses gives him a better target to aim at - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Great Blasket did that nicely and was tough. We were a little bit worried that the ground would be a bit sharp for him but Shane said he travelled around nicely. He'll probably step up to a mile the next day - George Murphy, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual Tapeta winner who is back off the same mark as for the latest of his two turf wins in the summer, but his three efforts since returning to the AW in Sepember leave plenty to be desired.

runners.comment: All four wins over 7f/1m on Polytrack; third here nine days ago and should again go well
runners.name: Rey De La Batalla
runners.spotlight: Two wins over 7f here but has won twice over this trip at Kempton; ran well to finish third of 12 back here (7f) nine days ago and again shouldn't be far away if producing a similar performance.

runners.comment: Return to 1m should suit but a record of 0-27 since arriving in Britain is hard to ignore
runners.name: Way To Dubai
runners.spotlight: Return to 1m should suit with all three wins in Germany coming over this trip and further; often placed (including around here) but a record of 0-27 since arriving in Britain is hard to ignore.

15:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Record on Polytrack this year reads 113124; has won fresh before; shortlisted
runners.name: Lady Manzor
runners.spotlight: Three wins on Polytrack in the first four months of the year and is 2-2 over C&D; has run well in both starts since returning to the AW in August and although not seen in 99 days she has won fresh before; shortlisted.

runners.comment: All four wins have come at around 1m; could play a part if getting a solid pace to run at
runners.name: Gaiety Musical
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who ran well when second of seven at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) five weeks ago; all four wins have come at around 1m, but she could play a part if getting a solid pace to run at.

runners.comment: Well beaten at Wolverhampton and needs to bounce back in the returning cheekpieces
runners.name: Kindest Nation
runners.spotlight: All four wins have come over this trip including two on Tapeta, but she was well beaten at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) on Saturday; needs to bounce back in the returning cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: She really surprised me last year, not only by how much she grew given she was a small two-year-old but how she improved through the year. She likes give in the ground and we'll try to get some black type with her. She's done well from three to four, so I'm also hopeful she can win a handicap or two along the way. 09-04-25

runners.comment: Weighted to reverse April C&D running with Lady Manzor but modest of late
runners.name: Handle With Care
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over 6f here in March, though she was only beaten a head by Lady Manzor over C&D the following month; 8lb better off with that rival but recent efforts raise doubts as to whether she can take advantage.

runners.comment: Held at Wolverhampton last time but won over C&D the time before; good chance on that form
runners.name: Penelope Valentine
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come over 7f on the AW, the latest when beating 13 rivals here last month; her consistent run of form ended at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last time but she would have every chance if putting that behind her.

runners.comment: Record on turf reads 222, but has beaten a total of one rival in three starts on the AW
runners.name: Crystal Dagger
runners.spotlight: Record on turf reads 222 but she has beaten a total of one rival in three starts on the AW; not hard to have reservations.

15:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Three turf wins but 0-8 on AW and well held over C&D recently on second run for yard
runners.name: Balon Dor
runners.spotlight: Three turf wins but 0-8 on AW and he didn't run much of a race over C&D recently when all aids were left off (blinkers return, again without regular tongue-tie) on second run for yard; drawn wide and likely other days.

stable_tour.quote: He made the perfect start when successful at Musselburgh in April. He ran third at the Chester May meeting and second at Epsom but hasn't added to that debut win. He has picked up plenty of prize-money along the way and he could go to York next week for the 7f nursery. He seems versatile as regards ground and I'm hopeful he'll add to his gains this year. 17-08-23

runners.comment: Two C&D wins; well treated and hinting at a revival here in the autumn; below best latest
runners.name: Mart

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: The last three times Mart has been here, he's had such a bad draw, so today I said to Dylan [Cunha, trainer]: "I'm drawn out in the car park again, I'm just going to have to make the most of him" and I did well enough to get where I wanted. I thought I was beaten turning in but then he hit his last gear and motored home to win quite nicely - Rhys Clutterbuck, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins and one on turf here, when 2lb higher in May; was running well enough over C&D in the autumn to think he can find another race, despite a lesser run at Newcastle (has won there) latest; thereabouts if back to best.

runners.comment: Good Polytrack form earlier in 2025; ready winner of C&D novice latest; solid option
runners.name: Lazzar
runners.spotlight: Had good Polytrack form elsewhere earlier in the year; bled from the nose in October but he was always holding the whip hand when fast away and making all over C&D four weeks ago (under Ryan Moore; from a subsequent novice winner); one of the better options back in a handicap.

runners.comment: On latest winning mark from July; had the odd excuse since; first 6f run since 2yo debut
runners.name: Faustus
runners.spotlight: Often leads; has had the odd excuse since the latest of many 5f wins, at Newbury (off today's mark) in July, but he hasn't run over 6f since his 2yo debut and others are much more tempting.

runners.comment: Ready C&D winner back at 6f, then followed up at Wolverhampton; well treated on past form
runners.name: Twilight Madness
runners.owner: P R Hedger & P C F Racing Ltd

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Twilight Madness gave me a really good feel up to halfway but the horse who was making it couldn't really take me far enough and he was dossing a bit once in front - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Mostly ordinary efforts since returning from absence in the spring but he set to work with a will when making all on the return to 6f over C&D this month, and might have had the edge taken off him when winning in a tighter finish under a penalty at Wolverhampton five days later; 2lb higher here but still well treated on 2024 form; respected.

runners.comment: In good form but 10lb higher than Wolverhampton win (6f) in November; below best latest
runners.name: Woodhay Whisper
runners.spotlight: In good form over C&D and at Wolverhampton, going close behind Profit Street at the latter track two starts ago; however, she's 10lb higher than for her win there in November and wasn't quite at her best last time out (regular hood left off, now refitted); needs more for the win.

runners.comment: Two turf wins here in August (7f and 6f); two mystifying defeats on Polytrack this month
runners.name: Comedian Leader

prev_owners.owner: Aj Racing G Kelleway N Sowerby D Beedle

runners.spotlight: Two turf wins here (7f and 6f) in August but two mystifying runs on Polytrack (has won on the surface) since back from a break and it's hard to predict a revival today.

runners.comment: Both AW wins on Tapeta; has gone into reverse since 6f turf wins in July; cheekpieces off
runners.name: Twirler
runners.spotlight: Both AW wins on Tapeta; won two 6f races on turf in July but she took a wrong turn after, including over C&D, and returns from a break without her regular cheekpieces; has it to prove.

runners.comment: Unable to sustain form since 7f win at Southwell in October; Polytrack debut
runners.name: Ardaddy
runners.spotlight: All AW runs on Tapeta; unable to sustain form, over 7f and 6f, since winning over the longer trip at Southwell in October and now makes his Polytrack debut; due to run 7.15 Newcastle on Monday.

stable_tour.quote: We've always thought he has a lot more ability than he's shown. He's got a low rating of 55 having been 0-5. He ran poorly on his last run 04-09-25

runners.comment: Well treated on best form; first win for yard this month; race not pan out over C&D since
runners.name: Profit Street

prev_owners.owner: D Jenkins J Glover R Odonnell J Short

runners.spotlight: Went through a fruitless spell for previous yard but was on a career-low mark when making stable debut in October and ended a losing run at Wolverhampton (6f) recently; had an awkward start and things never panned out over C&D since but he should still have scope off his current mark.

runners.comment: Maiden; can lead; has been running over 5f; unconvincing in most recent 6f runs
runners.name: South Shore Island
runners.spotlight: Maiden; can lead; ought to find a race on the pick of his sprint form but he hasn't found much in his most recent 6f attempts and the widest draw puts a damper on his prospects.

12:20.race_name: PricedUp Daily Racing Boosts Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Mrs P Souverain & Mr A De Boisbrunet
runners.comment: On dangerous mark but last win was two years ago and was tailed off last time
runners.name: Happy And Fine
runners.owner: L Cross, S Cross & J Fitzpatrick

prev_owners.owner: T Acott, L Cross, S Cross

quotes.race: Betfred 'Hot Shots' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Chasing was always going to be his game. He jumped brilliantly, especially out of that ground. Happy And Fine is going the right way - the question is whether we keep nudging our way up or go and have a pop at something - Alex Hales, trainer.

quotes.race: Summer Plate Day 22nd July 2023 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We liked Happy And Fine last year but he lost his way a bit as he was a bit weak. He had a really good summer. He's quite a nice horse in this grade and he wants a fence in time - Alex Hales, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won off 4lb higher at Haydock (2m4f, heavy) in December 2023 but he's failed to complete in four of his eight starts since and was tailed off at Chepstow 25 days ago; has plenty to prove and he's untried at this trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse bought for us by Charlie Mann out of France. His first run was a very encouraging one when third to Bombs Away at Sandown in November, and I fancied him to open his account back at the Esher track earlier this month, but he ran very flat and hung. He came back lame, but he is fine now and ran a good race at Catterick on Tuesday, when third. He has a rating of 108 which is very workable, and I am keen to get a win into him as he has new owners, and it would be great for them. 30-12-21

runners.comment: Only 1lb higher than for his last win and he could be dangerous on this return to 3m
runners.name: Immortal Fame

quotes.race: Grace And Dotty Fedora's And Feathers Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely thrilled to bits with that. Immortal Fame went so well throughout, had his ears pricked the whole way round and just thoroughly enjoyed himself. I've always been a bit worried about his jumping, but we've done a lot of schooling with him and it looks like the penny is starting to drop. We'll see what the handicapper does to us now but I think he can progress - Deborah Cole, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made it 3-7 over fences when completing a hat-trick at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) in February; mixed results in four subsequent runs but he ran respectably over 2m6f at Lingfield (fourth of ten) last month; has claims if he can build on that and he looks worth another try at this trip.

stable_tour.quote: He did very well last term in novice hurdles, winning three times and finishing up on a fair mark of 105. I gave him a pipe-opener at Chepstow last month when he finished third and went up 1lb. We started him off over fences at Doncaster on Saturday in a novice handicap chase company, and he made a good start to finish second. 30-11-22

runners.breeder: Yorton Farm Stud & A R Bromley
runners.comment: Unexposed over fences and could be a big factor if he gets into a good jumping rhythm
runners.name: Kilbarry Hill
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner who is unexposed over fences; never really got into a rhythm when third at Wetherby (3m, soft) 25 days ago but he wasn't beaten far and that was behind a well-handicapped rival; should have more to offer in this sphere and he could be a big factor, particularly if he can jump with more fluency.

runners.comment: Veteran who has lost his way and needs a major revival back in trip
runners.name: The Newest One
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on old chase form but last win was 14 months ago and he's been pulled up in three of his last five runs including at Ascot (3m5f, good) last month; this is a big drop back in trip and grade but he needs a major revival.

runners.breeder: A Domenjoud & Haras De Saint Voir
runners.comment: Should benefit from his reappearance run and he's in the mix off a workable mark
runners.name: Georges Saint

quotes.race: Sky Bet Request A Bet Female Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: This looked an ideal opportunity for Georges Saint, who is not a novice and basically he has just outstayed them. I thought we were booked for third at the second-last but the two leaders just fell in a heap - Jerry Roberts, spokesman for trainer Venetia Williams.

quotes.race: Owens Group Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: A couple of times Georges Saint came out of my hands, he was very exuberant. I got in front and he looked around a bit and the ground was really testing so he was getting a bit tired. He stuck his neck out though and was brilliant for me - Ned Fox, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: 9yo who has a record of 4-14 over fences; ended last season with a creditable third at Bangor (3m, soft) and he shaped as though he needed the run on his return visit last month; should be sharper this time and his last win was an emphatic success off 2lb higher; interesting contender.

runners.breeder: Mrs Larissa Kneip & Mrs Sandrine Grevet
runners.comment: Record of 2-5 over fences and was a clear second at Hereford three weeks ago; big player
runners.name: Captain Boudet
runners.spotlight: 6yo who is 2-5 over fences and bounced back with a clear second when upped to 3m1f at Hereford (good to soft; blinkers reapplied) three weeks ago; that was behind a major improver and he's a big player off only 1lb higher here.

runners.comment: 2-5 over fences and he went close over hurdles here on his penultimate run; respected
runners.name: Catch Catchfire
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo who has won two of his five chase starts and he went close over hurdles here (3m1f, soft) on his reappearance last month; held in 9l fifth back over fences at Kelso (4m, soft) last time but that was a decent effort from out of the weights and he still has potential in this sphere; respected on this drop back in trip/grade.

12:52.race_name: PricedUp The Jumps EBF Mares' "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' NH Novices' Qual') (GBB)

runners.breeder: N J Henderson And Mrs S A Aston
runners.comment: Uttoxeter winner (2m4f) and she could resume her progress on this step back up in trip
runners.name: Fresh As A Daisy
runners.spotlight: Delivered on promise shown in bumpers when keeping on well to make winning hurdle debut at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) in May; held in third under a penalty on Bangor reappearance (2m, soft) last month but she's now back in a mares' event and could resume her progress on this step back up in trip; respected.

stable_tour.quote: Life has been tough for her. She was always getting little niggly problems and was a bit fragile, but we've worked through it. She was too old for bumpers earlier this year, so we sent her over hurdles at Uttoxeter in May and she won nicely. She'll be a novice this season and she can go well. 21-10-25

runners.breeder: G Durrheim And Maria Mulcahy Durrheim
runners.comment: Ran well from out of weights in Class 2 handicap at Cheltenham; key player back in novice
runners.name: Pismo Beach
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of a good opportunity in a Hexham maiden (2m4f, good) on reappearance in October; flopped over C&D next time but she bounced back with a 7l fourth in Class 2 handicap at Cheltenham 18 days ago; that was a big run from out of the weights and she sets the standard back in a novice; key player.

runners.comment: Disappointing on hurdling debut at Fontwell but that was on heavy ground after an absence
runners.name: Ballynorth
runners.spotlight: Out of a Listed Flat winner who has bred several who stayed well over hurdles; sold for £32,000 in May after a promising third in an Irish point; disappointing when favourite on recent hurdling debut at Fontwell (2m3f) but that was on heavy ground after an absence and it wouldn't be a surprise if she showed a lot more this time.

runners.comment: 24,000euros 3yo; yard is in good form and she needs watching in market on debut
runners.name: Camshaft
runners.spotlight: 4,000euros foal, 24,000euros 3yo; first foal; dam point winner, sister to useful bumper/2m hurdle winner Thebarrowman, half-sister to useful bumper and 2m-2m7f hurdle/chase winner Warrantor; yard is in good form and she needs watching in market on debut.

runners.comment: Never involved on Lingfield debut but she's a possible improver on this step up in trip
runners.name: Coolkatie
runners.spotlight: 80,000euros half-sister to seven winners including Irish Saint (high-class 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Welsh Saint (bumper and 2m5f/3m hurdle); never involved when fourth on Lingfield debut (2m, good to soft) last month but she should know more this time and is a possible improver upped in trip; one to keep an eye on.

runners.comment: Promising third at Ludlow (2m5f) two weeks ago and has claims if she can build on that
runners.name: Country Mouse
runners.spotlight: Changed hands for £20,000 soon after winning a two-finisher mares' point at Ireland in February; down the field in first two runs under rules but she showed clear promise when third in a Ludlow novice (2m5f, good to soft) two weeks ago; hasn't looked straightforward but that latest form puts her in the picture and she's open to more progress.

runners.breeder: A Hales, Mr & Mrs J Fry, Mr D Fitzgerald
runners.comment: Big prices and finished tailed off in two bumpers; best watched on hurdling debut
runners.name: Flight Of Fable
runners.owner: Sir Bob, Stowe Racing & The Gumbrills
runners.spotlight: Big prices and finished tailed off in two bumpers this autumn; best watched on hurdling debut.

runners.breeder: Earl De Cordelles & Earl La Dariole
runners.comment: Promising third in sole point and was placed on hurdling debut at Wincanton; shortlisted
runners.name: Indannya
runners.spotlight: Promising third in sole point (2m4f, good) and she filled the same position on hurdling/stable debut at Wincanton (2m5f, good to soft) four weeks ago; was beaten less than 3l in that race and she should benefit from that reappearance run; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Point/bumper winner who ran into a smart prospect on hurdling debut at Exeter; dangerous
runners.name: Katies Melody
runners.spotlight: Point (3m, yielding) and bumper (2m, good to soft) winner who was a 24l second of six to a very useful prospect on last month's hurdle debut at Exeter (2m7f, good to soft); needs to step up on that form but she's open to improvement on this drop back in trip.

runners.comment: Well-related 6yo but she has something to prove on hurdling debut after a long absence
runners.name: Khutulun Khan
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to high-class bumper and 2m-4m hurdle/chase winner Rathvinden; promising third in Ascot bumper in February 2024 but she failed to match that form at Cheltenham two months later; now goes hurdling after 622 days off and has something to prove in this interesting race.

stable_tour.quote: She ran in two bumpers last season, finishing a promising third at Ascot on her debut and then running down the field at Cheltenham, where she picked up an injury and needed last season off. She's a very nice mare if we can keep her in one piece. 10-12-25

runners.comment: Went close in sole bumper but she's been well held in both hurdle runs this season
runners.name: Noble Grace
runners.spotlight: Lost out only by a neck in 18-runner Cheltenham bumper (good ground) on debut in April but she's been well held in two hurdle runs (2m3f/2m4f) this season; still early days in this sphere but she needs major improvement.

runners.comment: Struggled at a massive price on this month's debut at Huntingdon (2m4f, soft)
runners.name: One Cool Mix
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to two hurdle winners but she didn't show much at a massive price on this month's debut at Huntingdon (2m4f, soft); passed over.

runners.comment: Has struggled in a bumper and a novice hurdle; cheekpices are now added at this new trip
runners.name: Rose Of The Shires
runners.spotlight: Struggled in a bumper here last month and she failed to beat a rival on hurdling debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) last week; cheekpieces are now added and has lots to prove on this big step up in trip.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Lonray
runners.comment: Encouraging third at Huntingdon and he needs watching in market on handicap debut
runners.name: Luwdvig
runners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in two bumpers in spring 2024; well held in three hurdle runs this year but he made some late headway when third at Huntingdon (2m4f, soft) 24 days ago; that was an encouraging effort and has possibilities if he can build on that on handicap debut

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Unexposed 5yo and he's a possible improver on handicap debut; needs close look
runners.name: Madajovy
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two spring bumpers; subsequent hurdle form has been underwhelming but it's still early days in this sphere and he's a possible improver now upped in trip on handicap debut; needs a close look for top yard.

runners.comment: Responded well to a hood when winning at Huntingdon last month; respected up 5lb
runners.name: A Good Yomp
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in his first two starts this season but he fared markedly better with 28-1 win at Huntingdon (2m3f, good to soft; hood added) last month; up 5lb for that narrow success but he showed a good attitude and should have more to offer in headgear; respected.

runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs B E Moore
runners.comment: Inconsistent eight-race maiden and she needs to get back near best
runners.name: Dont Tell Rosie
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; runner-up on handicap debut at Taunton (2m3f, good to soft) in February but she's not gone on from that and was never involved at Chepstow (fifth of 12) last month; now goes back up in trip but she needs to get back near best.

runners.comment: Has struggled in three hurdle runs and needs a transformation on handicap debut
runners.name: Local Derby
runners.spotlight: Won on Irish point debut in May 2024 but returned from layoff with three low-key hurdle runs (2m4f-2m7f) this autumn/winter; still unexposed and is a brother to a useful jumper but he needs a transformation on handicap debut.

runners.comment: No progress over hurdles and she's struggled in both handicaps; plenty to prove
runners.name: Katira Du Mestivel
runners.spotlight: Promising second on hurdling debut at Fontwell (2m3f, soft) last December but she's been disappointing since including two heavy defeats in handicaps; in good hands and now goes back up in trip but she needs a big turnaround; tongue-tie removed.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo and he looks interesting back up in trip in only his second handicap
runners.name: Following Chapter
runners.spotlight: Beaten 22l at Hereford (2m, good) on last month's seasonal/handicap debut, but he made some late gains and should benefit from that run; still early days after only four starts and he looks interesting on this step back up in trip.

runners.comment: Point winner but she's 0-11 under rules and has been pulled up in last two starts
runners.name: Wednesday Addams
runners.spotlight: Point winner but she's 0-11 under rules and has been pulled up over fences (2m5f) and hurdles (2m3f) in last two runs; mark is tumbling but she has lots to prove and needs a major revival.

runners.comment: Fair fourth at Leicester last month but he's now 0-10 over hurdles; down the list
runners.name: Arctic Saint
runners.spotlight: Reappeared with a fair fourth at Leicester (2m4f, soft) last month but that took his hurdling record to 0-10 and he needs to find more to defy this mark.

runners.breeder: M Gonzalez De Canales & L Laigre
runners.comment: Inconsistent nine-race maiden and was tailed off at Doncaster 19 days ago
runners.name: Meraki Mist
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; made a positive start for new yard when runner-up at Fontwell (2m3f, good) in June but he returned after another break with a disappointing run at Doncaster 19 days ago; has bit to prove again after that and others are more convincing.

runners.comment: 5yo who was clear when falling at the last at Hereford on his penultimate run; in the mix
runners.name: Wistmans Prince
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in his qualifying runs but he was clear when falling at the last on handicap debut at Hereford (2m3f, good) last month; held in fourth off this revised mark there last time but that was another creditable effort and he still has potential after only six starts; in the mix.

runners.comment: Unexposed chaser and she's a possible improver with cheekpieces added; in the mix
runners.name: Northern Air
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground point winner who won a maiden hurdle (2m, good to soft) for Fergal O'Brien in January; hasn't lived up to market expectations in two chase runs for new yard this season but it's still early days over fences and first-time cheekpieces could help; dangerous off sliding mark.

stable_tour.quote: A new mare to us, she's a lovely type who's ready to go chasing - starting in a 2m4f mares' handicap at Carlisle on Monday. I don't know much about her yet but she gives the team a good feel at home and I think she can do the business over fences. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Has patchy record over fences and he comes risks attached after another break
runners.name: Roger Rarebit
runners.spotlight: Won on chase debut at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy) in November 2023 but has mixed record since and was pulled up at Kelso (2m7f; bled from the nose) in his final run last season; still 3lb higher than for his chase win and he comes with risks attached after another break.

stable_tour.quote: He made his debut last December when third in a junior bumper at Hereford. He had to run him at the time for the benefit of his mental state. In fairness he is a big individual who was very precocious, but he'll start back over hurdles. 19-10-21

runners.comment: Won at Fontwell last December but he's not gone on from that and others are preferred
runners.name: Koenigsstern

quotes.race: Daily Offers With BetMGM Handicap Chase (Fontwell Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Koenigsstern had been running really well without winning, but here I thought he jumped incredibly well. He'd already qualified for the final before this, but we want to keep them running and this looked like the right race, but the final will be the target now. All of my horses are running really well, so long may it continue - Nick Gifford, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won over fences at Fontwell (2m2f, soft) last December but he's not gone on from that in four runs since; may have needed his reappearance run at Fontwell three weeks ago but he has a patchy profile and others are more convincing.

stable_tour.quote: He won a handicap chase at Fontwell on Boxing Day last year. He was in at Plumpton on Monday, but we decided to wait and may now go to Fontwell next week, which is probably the sensible option. He's the sort who'll win a race every season. 03-12-25

runners.comment: Only 1lb higher than for his hurdle win and he needs a close look on chase debut
runners.name: The Grey Man
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-8 over hurdles but his win came off a similar mark and he was a creditable fourth on his Ffos Las reappearance (2m4f, soft) in October; out of a sister to a smart chaser and has possibilities if he takes to this new discipline.

runners.comment: 3-9 over fences and was close fourth at Lingfield last time; respected back up in trip
runners.name: Bobbis Beauty

quotes.race: Belvoir Mares' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That's our first winner since Pinnacle Park won at the Cheltenham October meeting and this game drives you mad. We've had plenty of seconds and thirds of late, so they've not been running badly and it's nice to get a winner. We weren't going to run Bobbi's Beauty over fences until next season but she'd been schooling well at home - Martin Keighley, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 3-9 over fences and she was as good as ever when a close fourth at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) 18 days ago; looks interesting off unchanged mark and her first chase win was a dominant display over this trip.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Camp Benard
runners.comment: Unexposed 6yo but she needs a transformation on this switch to chasing
runners.name: Almeirinda
runners.spotlight: Showed promise over hurdles in France but she's struggled in two runs for current yard, including on handicap debut at Leicester (1m7f, heavy) last month; still unexposed after only five starts but she needs a transformation on this switch to chasing.

runners.comment: Hat-trick seeker who won by 14l at Market Rasen last time; big player again for new yard
runners.name: Pescatorius
runners.spotlight: In good form for Olly Murphy this autumn, winning in blinkers at Sedgefield (3m2f, good to firm) and Market Rasen (2m5f, good to soft); up another 9lb but he was a runaway winner last time and is open to more progress for new yard; strongly respected in change of headgear.

runners.comment: Last win was three years ago and he's 0-6 over fences; down the list
runners.name: Rathmacknee
runners.spotlight: Well treated on old form but last win was over hurdles in December 2022 and he's 0-6 over fences; ran respectably at Stratford (2m6f, good to soft) in October but he returns after another break and this is competitive; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He came in late last season and spreadeagled a Fakenham field on his final run in May after a soft palate operation. He was going to the sales but wasn't making much, so was bought back. We've schooled him over fences but he's still a novice over hurdles, so I expect he'll have a busy campaign, which could include part one over hurdles and then part two over fences. 24-10-22

runners.comment: Made a promising start over fences when clear second at Hereford; respected up 2lb
runners.name: Cornish Comedy
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 5yo who made a promising start over fences when second of 13 at Hereford (2m5f, good to soft) three weeks ago; nudged up 2lb but that was a clear personal best last time and and he pulled clear of the third; interesting contender.

14:22.race_name: Download The PricedUp App Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers' Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Back from long absence with tailed-off effort at Newbury and he's untried at this trip
runners.name: Benign Dictator
runners.spotlight: Won here (2m5f, soft) in November 2023 but he returned after 672 days off with a tailed-off effort at Newbury last month; now takes a big drop back in grade but he has something to prove after that comeback run and is untried at this trip.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner but he's been disappointing in both handicaps and has bit to prove
runners.name: Sunshine Diamond

quotes.race: Weatherbys Stallion Book Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're very happy with what Sunshine Diamond did there. He's a nice horse but lacked a recent run, so he had to do it the hard way. He really dug deep - Neil Mulholland, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Followed up his Irish maiden win in four-runner Southwell novice (also 3m on good) last October but he's been disappointing in two handicaps since; still unexposed over hurdles but he was remote second at Doncaster last month and needs to resume his progress at this new trip.

runners.comment: Bounced back with good second at Uttoxeter; respected on first run after wind surgery
runners.name: Kaituna River
runners.spotlight: Point winner who is 1-12 under rules but he got back on track with a good second at Uttoxeter (2m7f, soft; tongue-tie removed) last month; nudged up 2lb but he has shaped like a thorough stayer and is respected on his first run after wind surgery.

runners.comment: Reappeared with a near-miss here (3m1f) last month and she's only gone up 1lb; key player
runners.name: Getaway Theatre
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who ended last season with a win at Chepstow and she reappeared with a near-miss here (3m1f, soft) last month; that was in a tight four-way finish but she's only gone up 1lb and she still has potential as a stayer; respected.

runners.comment: 0-7 but he went close on handicap debut at Ffos Las (3m) last month; respected up 3lb
runners.name: Seatoit
runners.owner: Julie And David R Martin And Dan Hall
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but he started his handicap career with a close call on his reappearance at Ffos Las (3m, soft) last month; up 3lb but he stayed on strongly from off the pace last time and is open to more progress at this new trip; interesting contender.

stable_tour.quote: He was favourite for a bumper at Cheltenham which was a bit bonkers but I do think he's a very nice horse. He wants soft ground and in hindsight we maybe shouldn't have gone there, but it was good to get a run into him. He's schooled nicely and as soon as we get his ground he'll go hurdling. He's a very imposing horse with a lot of size and scope, and should make a nice three-mile hurdler and chaser, in time. 19-11-24

He was second under a massive weight at Ffos Las over 3m on soft ground when running into one of Tom Symonds', Mister Barclay, that had very good form. I think he might be progressive and he wants very soft ground. He's another you'll see over the Christmas and new year period. 24-12-25

runners.comment: Has struggled under both codes for current yard and he needs a big turnaround
runners.name: Vaguely Royal

quotes.race: Five-Rivers Fostering Doncaster Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I rode Vaguely Royal at Chepstow last time, we made the running and a combination of him still being green and getting lonely in front cost us the race. We were very confident coming here today, I just wanted to make sure I got a lead. William was going pretty steady in front, I wound him up in plenty of time but he won cosily. He's not a slow horse and I wouldn't see him getting much further than a mile and a half - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Useful Flat performer who won a maiden hurdle last October but he's 0-9 since and has struggled under both codes in three runs for current yard; mark continues to fall but he needs a big turnaround at this new trip; blinkers are removed and cheekpieces return.

runners.comment: Second at Market Rasen and he should have more to offer in staying handicaps; shortlisted
runners.name: Harry Bright
runners.owner: The Nigel Jones & Roy Ovel Syndicate
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden but he ran his best race so far when runner-up at Market Rasen (2m7f, good to soft) four weeks ago; up 4lb but he kept on well last time and should have more to offer in staying handicaps; respected with cheekpieces added.

stable_tour.quote: He's improved over novice hurdles. He's a big, strong, scopey horse who will jump a fence in time, but I like to think that he can work his way up from the lower rungs and leave behind what he's done so far. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Triple hurdle winner but she's not been at her best since returning after wind surgery
runners.name: Jolie Baie
runners.spotlight: Triple hurdle winner at up to 3m but she's not been at her best in two runs since returning after wind surgery last month; mark is sliding but she needs to rediscover her spark back up in trip.

runners.comment: Point/hurdle winner and he should have a future over fences; needs a close look
runners.name: Youdecide

quotes.race: Join The 20 Club At Huntingdon Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Youdecide has enjoyed the step up in trip here and will make a nice horse next year when he strengthens up - Tom David, trainer's assistant.

runners.spotlight: Won his point on heavy; mixed record in seven runs over hurdles but he won at Huntingdon (2m4f, good) in March and was a creditable fourth back there (2m4f, soft; cheekpieces added) 24 days ago; closely related to a chase winner and he needs a close look on this switch to fences.

runners.breeder: Messrs M E & A D I Harris
runners.comment: 10yo who has been placed in his last two runs but overall record is now 1-28
runners.name: Chestnut Pete
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has finished placed at Hereford (2m) and Taunton (2m2f, both on good) in his last two runs; remains feasibly treated and has form on soft ground but overall record is now 1-28 and others are more persuasive.

runners.comment: Well treated on his best hurdle form and has claims if he takes to this new discipline
runners.name: Hawk Stone
runners.spotlight: Just 1-11 over hurdles but his win was off 5lb higher and he reappeared with a front-running third at Leicester (1m7f, soft; first-time blinkers) four weeks ago; should benefit from that run and has possibilities if he takes to this new discipline.

runners.comment: Off the mark with an emphatic win at Hexham three weeks ago; big player again up 8lb
runners.name: Stick With Me Sam
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Jw Dale & & Mrs Jdj Copas
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on his sixth start over fences when justifying support in good style at Hexham (1m7f, heavy) three weeks ago; up 8lb but he hit a personal best with that emphatic win and is open to more progress in this sphere; big player.

runners.comment: Overall record of 0-17 and was pulled up at Hereford last month; others preferred
runners.name: Blackijo Dagrostis
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on chase debut at Stratford (2m1f, good) in May but he's not gone on from that and was pulled up at Hereford last month; overall record is now 0-17 and he needs a major revival with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Nine-race maiden who has been pulled up in two of his three runs over fences; opposable
runners.name: Misteroddsocks
runners.spotlight: Promising third in a bumper last December but he's struggled to get competitive since and has been pulled up in two of his three starts over fences; dropped another 3lb but he needs a transformation back in trip.

runners.comment: 0-12 under rules but he's run well in last three starts and should be in the mix again
runners.name: El Rojo Grande
runners.owner: Genghis Racing & Mike Harris Racing Club
runners.spotlight: 0-12 under rules but was runner-up in his final two starts last season and he reappeared with a creditable effort at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) 18 days ago; should be in the mix again and he's versatile ground-wise.

15:22.race_name: PricedUp Supports British Racing Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Comfortably made all at Hereford on debut and he's a key player under a 7lb penalty
runners.name: Smile John Boy
runners.spotlight: 10-1 when comfortably making all on debut in 14-runner bumper at Hereford (2m, good) last month; carries a 7lb penalty today but he's a very likeable prospect and his trainer continues in fine form; key player.

runners.comment: Second foal; dam well held in bumper; a watching brief is advised on debut
runners.name: Earl Chester
runners.owner: D S Frankland & D J Trott
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam well held in bumper, half-sister to winners including Tarablaze (2m3f-3m1f hurdle/chase; RPR 144) and No Guarantees (2m3f hurdle; 129); a watching brief is advised on debut.

runners.comment: Third on debut at Doncaster in March; pedigree provides optimism he'll improve
runners.name: Eternity Rose
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 6l when third of 12 at 7-1 on debut at Doncaster (2m, good) in March; his pedigree provides optimism he'll improve and he's in with an each-way shout once more.

runners.comment: Related to winners but tailed off at 100-1 on debut at Uttoxeter in October
runners.name: Play On Court
runners.spotlight: Related to winners but tailed off at 100-1 on debut at Uttoxeter (2m, good to soft) in October and a transformation is needed.

runners.comment: Point winner who has joined top yard for rules career and could play a leading role
runners.name: Risky Obsession
runners.spotlight: Won by a head on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, good to yielding) in April; sold for 170,000euros in May then went for £190,000 at the David Maxwell dispersal sale in October; he's joined a top yard for his rules career and he could play a leading role this afternoon.

stable_tour.quote: An Irish point-to-point winner, he possibly didn't quite stay the three miles that day but travelled really well through the race and will win a bumper this year. I like him. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Belied market weakness when 1l runner-up at 12-1 on debut; open to improvement
runners.name: Soldier Poet
runners.spotlight: Flat bred; belied market weakness when 1l runner-up at 12-1 on this month's debut at Plumpton (2m2f, soft); open to improvement and might not be far away.

stable_tour.quote: A bumper horse who made his debut at Plumpton on Monday and was beaten only a length in second. He didn't run in any points and was taking on horses who have. I don't think he wants deep winter ground but soft round Plumpton seemed lovely. I'm hopeful he'll make up into a nice staying novice hurdler next season. 03-12-25

runners.comment: Brother to useful Onemorefortheroad but trainer isn't known for bumper winners
runners.name: T R Five
runners.spotlight: Second foal; brother to useful bumper and 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Onemorefortheroad; dam bumper/2m4f hurdle winner (RPR 105), out of bumper/2m-2m4f hurdle winner (124); a market check is advised given his pedigree but his stable isn't known for bumper winners so he may be one for later on.

runners.comment: There's some potential in her pedigree but she was well beaten on October's debut
runners.name: Illhaveabitofthat
runners.spotlight: There's some potential in her pedigree but she was well beaten on October's debut in a mares' bumper at Aintree (2m1f, good to soft; 18-1) and she needs to be an entirely different proposition today.

runners.comment: Showed ability on this month's debut at Chepstow; may take a step forward for in-form yard
runners.name: Midnight Doyen
runners.spotlight: 9-1, showed ability when fifth of eight behind a shorter-priced stablemate on this month's debut at Chepstow (2m, good to soft); related to winners and she may be able to take a step forward for her in-form yard.

runners.comment: Perhaps didn't stay the 3m last time at Aintree but now has questions to answer
runners.name: Pyramid Place
runners.owner: Royal Arch Racing Pp & Gary Campbell

quotes.race: William Hill Cumbria Crystal Cup Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We bought Pyramid Place off John Gosden and he's had a few issues but he's really holding his form together. It was a quick return for him because he ran at Newton Abbot a few days ago and he needs a pace to aim at - Milton Harris, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Below his last winning mark but became disappointing for Olly Murphy and another quiet run at Aintree on first start back with Harriet Dickin; perhaps didn't stay the 3m but now has questions to answer.

stable_tour.quote: He did us proud last season, winning three times over hurdles, and despite not adding to his tally this term he has run well in defeat, notably when second at Chepstow and third at Doncaster. Unfortunately, he bled last time at Fontwell and was pulled up, so we have given him some time to get over those exertions. He's in good order now and could go for the same race as Global Agreement at Lingfield this weekend. His preference is for better ground and, although he'll jump a fence, we'll stick to hurdles for the rest of this season. 19-01-22

runners.comment: Ex-Olly Murphy; 100-1 for a Cheltenham handicap on stable debut and ran accordingly
runners.name: Prince Imperial

quotes.race: Hazelton Mountford Insurance Brokers Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Prince Imperial won well and he's just improved and improved. He stays very well and he's got that bit of confidence back again. He'll improve again for a step up in trip and might win a nice staying race during the summer on a sound surface - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Prince Imperial has had a light campaign, he's tough and wins on the all-weather so we'll keep him going through the winter. There'll be six runners in those two-mile races after Christmas so it makes sense to target them - Richard Hughes, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Multiple winner for Olly Murphy and a decent run at Bangor in September on final outing for that yard; 100-1 for a Cheltenham handicap on stable debut and ran accordingly; this isn't so challenging but others are preferred.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Sir Michael Stoute's yard last summer and he has done great since, winning at Bath in October, and last month he bolted up by six lengths at Chelmsford. We have learned that he is more effective going left-handed and we will give him one or two more runs and then save him for an all-weather campaign in the winter. There is a decent programme for him in 0-100 handicaps on artificial surfaces, and for a bargain buy - he only cost 50,000gns - I think we are going to have a lot of fun with him. 14-07-21

runners.comment: C&D winner; another good run at Leicester last time on soft ground perhaps not ideal
runners.name: John Barbour

quotes.race: John Haine Memorial Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: John Barbour is full of ability but he's very quirky. When he won his first bumper he beat some lovely horses and then the next day didn't really go to plan. He then travelled and jumped all at Ludlow. If you could guarantee he could focus his mind he'd be a very good horse. Johnny [Burke] does a brilliant job on him. He's the sort of horse we might look at the Persian War with. We'll run him again because he needs experience, even if he's beaten - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a C&D handicap in October (good to soft) and ran just as well in defeat after a 5lb rise at Leicester where soft ground might have been ideal; up another 3lb but firmly enters the reckoning.

runners.comment: Has come up short in both his handicaps but ran well and should be bang there
runners.name: Woodland Park
runners.spotlight: Strong in the market for both his handicaps (2m1f/2m4f; soft) but came up just short, last time finishing close up behind John Barbour; closely matched with that rival and should be bang there.

stable_tour.quote: He bolted up in a bumper at Market Rasen in April and made a pleasing debut at Carlisle. He'll learn on the job and will definitely win his maiden and novice. 24-10-24

runners.comment: Nothing to show for three runs for current yard and headgear would appear a cry for help
runners.name: Menaggio

quotes.race: Nick Embiricos Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I think Menaggio was very good. He was a bit long at the first ditch but on the whole I was delighted with his jumping and he saw it out well. I hadn't really looked beyond this race. We just wanted to get him started. We'll sit down and have a think but he's a nice prospect and he'll get further. I think he'd get three [miles] but we're not in a rush to get there. That was a sharp as he wants there. Hopefully, he's progressing - Alan King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Good mark on his form for Alan King but nothing to show for three runs for current yard, all over fences; the new headgear would appear a cry for help.

stable_tour.quote: He only won once over hurdles last season but his final second at Kempton was a good effort, probably his best run. He made a winning chase debut over 2m3½f at Plumpton on Monday, jumping really well and staying on powerfully. I hope he'll continue to progress, particularly over slightly further. 25-10-24

He was the first of my exciting team of novice chasers to win over fences and he did the job well at Plumpton, jumping soundly and staying on powerfully. He'd shown decent form as a hurdler and should continue to progress, particularly over slightly further than 2m4f. 07-11-24

runners.breeder: R D & Mrs J S Chugg
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner; not the best of starts over fences last season (B7P); wind op since
runners.name: Galassian

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Galassian showed a fair bit of class in his point-to-points and has always promised to be a nice horse. This trip was on the short side for him on paper but the conditions really suited him - Mel Rowley, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner; it wasn't the best of starts over fences last season (B7P) and he's had a wind operation since.

stable_tour.quote: He was really unlucky to be brought down on his chasing debut at Haydock, but it couldn't be helped. We were hopeful he'd run a good race there. Although he was brought down early on, he galloped and jumped for the rest of the race, so we were mindful that he needed a little bit of time after it. The ground is key for him - the soft ground at Haydock looked ideal - but he's very well now and he'll have entries over fences again in the next fortnight. 16-01-25

runners.comment: Beaten in two maidens for this yard but unexposed now handicapping back up in trip
runners.name: Catch On Me
runners.spotlight: Placed over hurdles in France; beaten 41l and 16l in two maidens for current yard but there are races in him and returning to further should suit today on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Regressed for Gordon Elliott and makes stable debut after a mammoth absence
runners.name: Rock On Cassie

quotes.race: Punchestown Members Club Mares' Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rock On Cassie is a mare that we will have a bit of fun with and she will jump a fence too - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Regressed for Gordon Elliott after winning a maiden hurdle and tried chasing; makes stable debut after a mammoth absence.

stable_tour.quote: A Punchestown bumper winner who was in the process of running a big race when he came down two out in a Listed race at Navan. She'll pay her way this season. 18-10-22

13:13.race_name: Feast Streat Great Tasting Food Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Signed off for Olly Murphy on a downer and no sign of a revival on stable debut last month
runners.name: Itsnoteasy
runners.spotlight: Signed off for Olly Murphy on a downer and no sign of a revival on stable debut last month; tries blinkers.

runners.comment: Hasn't had a lot of racing and thereabouts in 3m/3m1f handicaps on last two outings
runners.name: Farmer Jimmy
runners.owner: J Scarrow, I Barker & S Turner
runners.spotlight: Hasn't had a lot of racing and thereabouts in 3m/3m1f handicaps on last two outings; unlikely to be far away.

runners.comment: Still a maiden but has run well enough in handicaps to believe he'll have his day
runners.name: Sandscape
runners.spotlight: Now 0-10 and a bit below his best in the first-time visor at Aintree (3m, soft) last time but previous placed efforts bring him into it (at 2m7f on good/good to soft).

runners.comment: Good run at Haydock last time behind an Irish raider who was ahead of his mark
runners.name: La Higuera
runners.spotlight: Has run well in 3m handicaps on last two outings, latterly behind an Irish raider who was ahead of his mark (on good to soft at Haydock); made some mistakes there but he's still learning after only six starts; much respected.

stable_tour.quote: He's another one who's been a bit of a slow developer but the penny is beginning to drop with him and he was second at Haydock on his last run behind Small Town Hero. He's still a little bit novicey but he's taking good steps forward now. He probably bumped into a good one last time. The plan was to go chasing quite quickly this season, but he's knocking on the door of winning a hurdle race and I think he will win one before we go over a fence with him. Staying chases are absolutely going to be his gig but hopefully we'll have plenty of fun with him this season first. 17-12-25

runners.comment: Has very low mileage for 10yo and was only 2l away under a positive ride at Hexham latest
runners.name: Superior Glance
runners.spotlight: Very low mileage for a 10yo and only 2l away under a positive ride at Hexham (2m7f, heavy) last time; this race looks deeper but she has each-way claims.

runners.comment: Potentially on a good mark for this return to hurdles and a visor is tried
runners.name: Hobbs Delight
runners.spotlight: Last eight races have been over fences and he was pulled up in the last two (ran well on occasions previously); capable hurdler off this mark and could be a player if back on song in a new visor (replaces cheekpieces).

runners.comment: Won easily in the new tongue-tie at Hereford and he looks to have turned a corner
runners.name: Glengolly
runners.spotlight: Had looked exposed in handicaps over a range of trips but he was well backed with a tongue-tie added at Hereford 11 days ago and won easily (3m1f, soft); raised 7lb but he looks to have turned a corner.

runners.comment: Without a win since March 2021 and into veteran stage; tailed off at Catterick recently
runners.name: Kauto Damour
runners.spotlight: Without a win since March 2021 and into the veteran stage now; tailed off at Catterick recently.

runners.comment: Won an Irish maiden hurdle in 2021; beaten in loads of handicaps and now 1-39 overall
runners.name: Coventry

prev_owners.owner: P Harrison & D A Harrison Racing
Sunday Racing Club & R M Kelleher

quotes.race: Boyne Valley Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Coventry went to the line well. He doesn't jump extravagantly but he is learning away and Bryan says he feels a little but unfurnished. Hopefully he can improve - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won an Irish maiden hurdle in 2021; beaten in loads of handicaps and now 1-39 overall; opposable.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with the way he ran on his first start for us at Punchestown last week. He seems a thorough stayer and we'll try to find a nice 3m handicap hurdle for him somewhere. 18-10-22

runners.comment: Could take a big step forward now up in trip off a lowly mark on handicap debut
runners.name: Donttellyamumjack
runners.spotlight: Some bumper promise; well beaten on his three hurdle starts (2m/2m4f) but could take a big step forward now up in trip off a lowly mark on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Latest fourth of seven at Exeter was encouraging and he has scope for improvement
runners.name: Bollin Thou
runners.spotlight: Pulled up when favourite for last month's seasonal, stable and handicap debut (first-time cheekpieces) but his recent fourth of seven at Exeter (2m7f, good to soft) was more encouraging; has the scope for improvement.

runners.comment: Fairly treated on winning form over hurdles/fences but not in great form recently
runners.name: Shesupincourt

quotes.race: Belvoir Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Mares' Chase Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Shesupincourt has been knocking on the door and was always going to win over fences, it's just been a matter of when. She loves testing ground so the conditions were ideal for her - she likes it borderline unraceable. Ryan Potter, trainer.

quotes.race: Yorton's "Postponed" Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Mares' Handicap Hurdle (RE Excellence)
quotes.quote: Shesupincourt was unlucky to unseat (chase debut) last time. She's a very nice mare to ride and is very game - James Turner, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Fairly treated on winning form over hurdles and fences but not in great form recently.
