runners.comment: The defeats have racked up since winning over C&D in May 2023; hasn't been running well
runners.name: Elfride
runners.spotlight: The defeats have racked up since winning over C&D in May 2023; hasn't been running well and she's out of the weights.

runners.comment: Has shown ability but he'll probably be of greater interest when tackling handicaps
runners.name: Arctic Conditions
runners.spotlight: In command when unseating at the final fence on debut in Irish maiden point in March 2024; however, he's yet to threaten under rules and will probably be of greater interest when tackling handicaps.

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.name: Dublin City
runners.owner: Mrs J A Benson & Miss S N Benson
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Ffos Las; failed to build on that at Haydock but still firmly in calculations
runners.name: Inishcorker
runners.spotlight: Irish maiden point winner (3m, yielding) who was a promising second at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) last month on his second hurdle start; failed to build on that when third of five at Haydock (3m, good to soft) but retains potential and his trainer won this last year; firmly in calculations.

runners.comment: Promise on both hurdle starts and the step up in trip may help; he's one to consider
runners.name: Lon Chaney
runners.spotlight: Point runner-up (3m, good) who built upon October's hurdle debut fifth at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) when second at Leicester (2m4f, soft); he could do with jumping better but the longer trip may help and he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Runner-up on hurdle debut at Bangor and he's in good hands to improve
runners.name: Firm But Fair
runners.spotlight: Remote third in sole Irish point (3m, soft) and beaten about 8l when second of five on hurdle debut at Bangor (2m7f, soft); improvement needed but he's in good hands and could strip fitter for that latest outing.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really nice horse. I was very pleased with him on his debut at Bangor last week as he travelled well and jumped nicely. He's probably not this year's horse as he's still quite raw, but he'll develop into a nice staying chaser for next season and beyond. He'll run over Christmas and I think he'll be progressive. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Similar to stablemate Kenzoko in that he's not shown a lot but now goes into a handicap
runners.name: In The Purple
runners.spotlight: Similar profile to stablemate Kenzoko in that he's not shown a lot but now goes into a handicap; however, Sean Bowen rides the yard's other one.

runners.comment: Modest so far but makes handicap debut with Sean Bowen riding for the first time
runners.name: Kenzoko
runners.spotlight: Has shown little in three starts over hurdles but makes handicap debut with Sean Bowen riding for the first time; any market move should be noted.

runners.comment: Only 3lb higher than for her Leicester win and Sam Twiston-Davies rides again
runners.name: Sophie Power
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in France who doubled her tally when edging home in a Leicester handicap on soft ground; only 3lb higher and Sam Twiston-Davies rides again.

runners.comment: Steadily regressive 8yo who has returned from a break with three disappointing runs
runners.name: Port Or Starboard

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Susan Davis, Mrs Melissa Oneill & Peter Mitchell

runners.spotlight: Steadily regressive 8yo who has returned from a break with three disappointing runs, two of those over hurdles; getting back on drier ground may help today but others are safer.

runners.breeder: Florence Thomas De Gigou & Tangi Saliou
runners.comment: Solid fourth of 13 in 2m4f Huntingdon handicap before falling midrace at Southwell
runners.name: Kally Des Bruyeres

quotes.race: Follow Us On X @betrhino Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We rated Kally Des Bruyeres very highly last year as one of our nicest young horses. He's clearly benefited from a wind op, and the better ground probably helped him - David Dennis, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Solid fourth of 13 in 2m4f Huntingdon handicap before falling midrace at Southwell; his profile is up and down.

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner in Ireland; modest over hurdles; now hooded
runners.name: Master Dunraven

quotes.race: Book Your Navan Summer BBQ Packages Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Master Dunraven was good today. We rode him quiet and it paid off as he came through them well. I needed a gap when I got it but to be fair, he did hit the line well - Ben Coen, rider.

runners.spotlight: Won two 1m2f handicaps when trained in Ireland; modest over hurdles (including in two handicaps) but Flat ability is respected and perhaps a hood can help.

runners.comment: Inconsistent and the ground was heavy when he made all here 12 days ago over 2m4f
runners.name: Eric Carmen
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and the ground was heavy when he made all here 12 days ago over 2m4f; might do well to defy an 11lb rise.

runners.comment: Beaten a good way in both his handicap hurdles and clearly needs to find something
runners.name: Saccary
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in France; beaten a good way in both his handicap hurdles and clearly needs to find something.

runners.comment: Doncaster winner (up 5lb since) last time and Harry Atkins now takes off 7lb
runners.name: Postponed Legacy
runners.spotlight: Front two clear when he defied a 5lb lower mark at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) last time and that despite racing freely, which is his way; considered with Harry Atkins taking off 7lb.

runners.comment: Feasibly treated on his best form and his Ludlow run back from a break was encouraging
runners.name: Churchman
runners.spotlight: No wins in 16 but feasibly treated on his best form and his Ludlow run back from a break was quite encouraging; possible.

runners.comment: Well handicapped on 2024 form but needs to raise his game
runners.name: Catboy
runners.spotlight: Not firing on all cylinders over hurdles this season and fell midrace on recent chasing debut; well handicapped on 2024 form but needs to raise his game.

runners.comment: Won a maiden hurdle in 2023 but has lost his way
runners.name: Jeepydoff Meel

prev_owners.owner: Dee Lestrange & Mrs Caren Walsh & John F Doyle

runners.spotlight: Won a maiden hurdle in 2023 but has lost his way.

runners.comment: Recent efforts have been uninspiring but she won a handicap at Bangor in February
runners.name: Chosen Bae
runners.spotlight: Won off a similar mark at Bangor in February, so can't be entirely ruled out, for all that her recent efforts have been uninspiring.

14:43.race_name: QuinnBet Daily Free Bet Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Useful winning hurdler (at up to 3m) but no sign of that form as yet over fences
runners.name: Tune In A Box

quotes.race: Blood-Stock.com Full Circle Series Final Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was watching Montregard throughout the race but I kept casting my eye back to Tune In A Box and I saw him travelling everywhere. I thought Montregard would be the horse to beat and would close him down, but he didn't and the winner is a horse who keeps surprising us - Tom Lacey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Useful winning hurdler (at up to 3m) but no sign of that form as yet over fences, albeit in just two attempts; best watched for now.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner; encouraging third of nine on his chasing debut at Bangor
runners.name: Il Va De Soi
runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles at about 2m4f on soft ground and he resumed from seven months off with an encouraging third of nine on his chasing debut at Bangor (2m4f, soft); he can build on it here so needs considering.

stable_tour.quote: He took to fences really well at Bangor first time out. I still think he's a bit high in the handicap but he jumped great and I was really pleased with his run. He'll improve for it and he loves soft ground. I think he's well up to winning a 0-120, but he's just above that at the moment. He's up to winning a decent chase over two and a half miles on soft ground. 19-11-25
He was placed in a couple of bumpers last season. He jumps really well and I'm really fond of him. I think he's going to start at Ascot on November 4. I think he's quite a nice horse. 18-10-23

runners.breeder: C R R Sweeting & Conduit Farm Stud
runners.comment: Point/novice hurdle winner who has been disappointing in his four handicaps; chase debut
runners.name: Keplers Law
runners.spotlight: Point/novice hurdle winner who has been disappointing in his four handicaps; may fare better as a chaser and a tongue-tie is added.

runners.comment: Probably should have won at Musselburgh latest and much respected off 3lb higher
runners.name: Disguisedlimit
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; runner-up in two handicap chases for his current yard and probably would have won the latest at Musselburgh (2m4f, soft) had he been more fluent over the last fence; much respected off 3lb higher.

stable_tour.quote: He came from Philip Hobbs and Johnston White and made a very promising start over fences last week when staying on really well. He's been keen in the past, so we had to ride him like that. He's a lovely big type who'll take a lot of beating next time. 20-11-25

A very nice horse we bought at Cheltenham in the spring from Ireland, where he won a point-to-point at Curraghmore on his debut. He'll be out in about two to three weeks' time and would be my Trainer's Pick. 30-10-24

runners.comment: Back from a long absence when third behind a stablemate on chase debut at Chepstow
runners.name: Genietoile
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer who showed promise in novice hurdles; third behind a stablemate on chase debut at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) last time and that was encouraging after a long absence.

runners.comment: Close up off 2lb lower over hurdles last time and should do better over fences
runners.name: Jacques Clouseau
runners.owner: Great Oakley Farms And Mrs Jane Fenwick
runners.spotlight: Beat Monday's Newbury winner Old Cowboy in his point; only his fourth run over hurdles and the first after wind surgery when close up in a small-field 2m4f handicap at Southwell last month; only 2lb higher for this chase debut and should be better over fences; contender.

runners.comment: Nearly won off this mark two runs back but he's returning from a long absence
runners.name: Mumfords Magic
runners.spotlight: 0-4 in points and 0-8 under rules, while a long absence casts further doubts; however, he did nearly win off this mark at Stratford in his penultimate race (2m6f, soft).

runners.comment: Well beaten in two chases at about 2m but still early days and he now goes in cheekpieces
runners.name: Wotter Trotter
runners.spotlight: Shaped okay during brief hurdling career; well beaten in two chases at about 2m but still early days and he now goes in cheekpieces; no surprise should he show more.

runners.breeder: Joel Denis, Clotilde De Barmon, Emmanuel
runners.comment: Different proposition when winning on chase debut at Huntingdon; raised a fair 6lb
runners.name: Kalhandrion

quotes.race: PricedUp Daily Racing Boosts Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I bought Kalahandrion for my wife as a foal and it's been a long haul but I said that he would be better over fences. He's still a young horse and we'll take our time with him - Richard Hobson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Different proposition when winning on chase debut at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) last month when the first two pulled a long way clear; this race is stronger but a 6lb rise isn't the end of the world.

runners.comment: Had wind op since quiet stable debut over hurdles; unexposed and Bowen is booked
runners.name: Just Forty
runners.spotlight: Ran well over hurdles and fences when trained in France; bought for 20,000euros; stopped quickly on stable debut over hurdles but he's had wind surgery since and the fitting of a tongue-tie could also be significant; unexposed and Bowen is booked.

runners.comment: Promising chase debut over 3m1f in January; unseated latest; ought to have potential
runners.name: Isle Of Gold
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden who showed promise in his only completed chase, at Warwick (3m1f, good to soft) in January when trying to give weight to one who is on a much higher mark now; unseated early on  return from a break but ought to have potential at this level.

stable_tour.quote: I like him. He did his first piece of work last Saturday and would be a few weeks away from returning. He was very weak and backward when we first got him, but he's coming into himself now. 19-11-24

runners.comment: Fell early on chase debut in January; won over hurdles on yard debut; has potential
runners.name: Keppel Queen
runners.spotlight: Made a hash of chase debut in January, guessing at the second and falling at the third, but she had shown hurdle promise previously and her staying strengths came to the fore when justifying a short price in 2m5f Warwick maiden hurdle in October on yard debut; this stamina test will suit better and she remains with chase potential.

runners.comment: Won Irish point in 2022 and 2m5f hurdle in 2023; some chase promise; off since March 2024
runners.name: Pougne Aminta

quotes.race: Wear A Hat Day Supporting braintumourresearch.org Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The ground was a lot better than I was expecting, that was the real worry here, Pougne Aminta loves galloping and I was very happy with her. Hopefully she'll be better over further trips in time - Paddy Brennan, rider.

runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in 2022 who won a 2m5f hurdle the following year; some chase promise at about 2m4f two winters ago but she found 3m on heavy ground against her when last seen in March 2024; unknown quantity.

runners.comment: Sole chase win came on this track (3m2f) in January; modest form since summer break
runners.name: Good Work
runners.spotlight: Sole chase win from 31 attempts came on this track (3m2f, good to soft) in January but he didn't run particularly well in October when back from a break and has been pulled up here since; has much to prove.

runners.comment: Made it 2-5 over fences in 2025 when winning over 3m at Wetherby; up 5lb; can do better
runners.name: Express Surprise
runners.spotlight: Has been running well in 3m chases all year, winning twice, and got a patient ride when forging away on the flat at Wetherby (soft) this month; raised 5lb but he's relatively unexposed and can do better yet.

runners.comment: Impressive on the step up to 3m when last seen in November 2024; entitled to need this
runners.name: Smurfette

prev_owners.owner: Colm Donlon And Alne Park Stud

runners.spotlight: Ended latest campaign with two wins from three starts, finding  an impressive finish when upped to 3m at Southwell (good) in November 2024 last time; one to be interested in but the layoff is a worry.

runners.breeder: Tommy James, Eoin Banville & Lucy Norton
runners.comment: Stout stayer who won 3m/2m7f hurdles in the spring; fair chase run latest after a break
runners.name: River Voyage
runners.spotlight: Modest chase form at the end of 2024 but he fared better back hurdling, winning at Ffos Las (3m, heavy) and Exeter (2m7f, good) in the spring; respectable effort back chasing at Chepstow following a break and he might make a go of it over fences this time round.

runners.comment: Two wins over 2m7f in early 2024; very mixed since but on a career-low mark
runners.name: Fortunefavorsdbold

quotes.race: Newlands Developments Mares' Novices' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier)(GBB)
quotes.quote: Fortunefavorsdbold loved the ground so we didn't mind it tipping down all morning - Matt Hall, syndicate member.

quotes.race: Watch Every Cheltenham Festival Race Live Only On Racing TV Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fortunefavorsdbold jumped quite well and was always trying to get as much cover as I could. Paul and James were anxious that I got a lead. Going as slow as we did probably helped - Sean Flanagan, rider.

runners.spotlight: Two chase wins  (2m7f; soft and heavy) in early 2024 when cheekpieces were first fitted; very mixed results since but she ran a fair race over C&D in November and runs off another career-low mark.

runners.comment: Irish point and dual winning hurdler; respectable chase debut; beaten long way out since
runners.name: Gata Ban
runners.spotlight: Irish point and dual hurdle winner (2m3f and 2m5f); has turned to fences relatively late in life and, after a respectable first attempt at Fakenham, she cried enough a long way out at Market Rasen in November; now goes in cheekpieces with something to prove.

runners.comment: Minor hurdle form, including on handicap debut; has it to prove now switched to fences
runners.name: Thickthorn Tom
runners.spotlight: Minor bumper and hurdle form, easy to back on handicap debut at Fontwell (2m5f, good to soft) in November when a well-held sixth; still very early in career but he has it to prove on chase debut; cheekpieces go on.

runners.comment: Modest strike-rate but stays well and could have a better season with yard going so well
runners.name: Emotional Roller
runners.spotlight: Modest strike-rate in Irish points (0-6) and under rules but he was the one who found the most when winning at Catterick (3m1f, good to soft) in January and he ran well there last time out; no surprise if he has a better time of it this winter with yard having a fine season.

runners.comment: Steep rise in weights for Hexham win in March; vulnerable since; needs weight off his back
runners.name: Gibberwell
runners.spotlight: Took a hefty rise in the weights for beating an unpenalised rival at Hexham (3m, good to soft) in March and it's been uphill for him since when completing; remains on 5lb higher mark and needs weight off his back.

runners.comment: Back to form when 2nd at Leicester (2m6f) but has not yet convinced in rare 3m runs
runners.name: Nine Nine Nine

quotes.race: Best Ticket Deals Online @ leicesterracecourse.co.uk Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Nine Nine Nine has been running well, but we've just been having mishaps with him. He's still got a lot to learn, so hopefully he can learn from that - Sarah-Jayne Davies, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Ran his best race for a while when runner-up at Leicester (2m6f, good to soft) three weeks ago but he has done nearly all his racing at up to that trip and has yet to shine at 3m; has more to prove than some.

runners.breeder: J R Hales & Miss L J Hales
runners.comment: 0-13; travelled strongly but didn't find much when upped to 3m latest; 4lb wrong
runners.name: Lone Soldier
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 13 starts; travelled strongly but didn't find a great deal off the bridle when upped to 3m at Southwell (good to soft) 17 days ago and stamina for this far still to prove; 4lb wrong as well.

15:43.race_name: Quinnbet Mares' Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: No match for a subsequent rules winner when second in a point bumper in April
runners.name: Arbor Rose
runners.spotlight: No match for a subsequent rules winner when second in a point bumper in April; showed something and should have a future.

runners.comment: Bred to have a future and from a yard that wins bumpers; interesting under Cobden
runners.name: Fern Gully
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to winners Disco Daisy (bumper/2m3f hurdle) and Queen Antionette (2m3f hurdle); dam 1m6f/2m winner (RPR 68), also placed in 2m3f hurdle; bred to have a future and from a yard that wins bumpers; Cobden booked.

runners.comment: Closely related to two winners including Soaring Glory (smart bumper/2m hurdle)
runners.name: Florences Dream
runners.spotlight: Closely related to two winners including Soaring Glory (smart bumper/2m hurdle); dam maiden in bumpers/2m-2m7f hurdles; the market should be informative.

runners.comment: 11-1, beaten about 9l on soft ground at Wetherby a month ago; may improve
runners.name: Jessies Giant
runners.spotlight: 11-1, beaten about 9l on soft ground at Wetherby a month ago; may improve.

runners.comment: 13,000euros 3yo; fourth foal; half-sister to 2m5f hurdle winner Farne Island
runners.name: Loro White
runners.spotlight: 13,000euros 3yo; fourth foal; half-sister to 2m5f hurdle winner Farne Island; dam point winner, half-sister to useful winners Wings Of Smoke (2m-2m4f hurdle/chase) and Kings Grey (bumper/2m-2m4f chase); of obvious interest for the Murphy/Bowen combination.

runners.comment: From a fine jumping family but yard not noted for winning bumpers
runners.name: Maggi Breeze
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to winners Bridget Breeze (bumper) and Balcomie Breeze (1m7f hurdle); dam last in bumpers, half-sister to smart 2m6f-3m hurdle winner Brindisi Breeze and useful bumper/2m hurdle winner Indigo Breeze; from a fine family but yard not noted for winning bumpers.

runners.comment: Outpaced and comfortably held at Sandown but did go off only 11-2
runners.name: Maria Mes
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a French 2m1f/2m3f hurdle/chase winner; outpaced and comfortably held at Sandown but went off only 11-2 and she's probably capable of better; stable won this last year and in 2019.

runners.comment: Bought for 100,000euros after finishing second in an Irish point; winner useful
runners.name: Millstatt Abbey
runners.spotlight: Bought for 100,000euros after finishing second in an Irish point (3m, good to yielding) and the winner has made a good start under rules for Gavin Cromwell; should be a good prospect.

runners.comment: In a different yard when beaten 5.5l into seventh of 18 in a Cheltenham bumper for mares
runners.name: Rainbow Tara
runners.spotlight: In a different yard when beaten 5.5l into seventh of 18 in a Cheltenham bumper for mares in April (good); now with Dan Skelton and she clearly has ability.

runners.comment: Questionable what she achieved when beaten 15l in a small field at Kelso (soft)
runners.name: Roberta Bishop
runners.spotlight: Questionable what she achieved when beaten 15l in a small field at Kelso (soft); others preferred.

runners.comment: Posted a modest RPR when a remote fourth at Doncaster (soft) and will need plenty more
runners.name: Capla Resdev
runners.spotlight: Posted a modest RPR when a remote fourth at Doncaster (soft) and will need plenty more here; now has tongue tied.

runners.comment: First foal out of a winning pointer; stable in form but 2-38 in bumpers recent seasons
runners.name: Superior Queen
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a winning pointer; stable in form but 2-38 in bumpers recent seasons.

12:35.race_name: Celebrating 175 Years At Punchestown Tote Beginners Chase

runners.comment: Looked vulnerable when falling four out in race in which Ballygunner Castle was second
runners.name: Argento Boy

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "Best Odds Guaranteed On Racing" Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Argento Boy felt much better today through the race. The further they went the better he felt. Ideally, he is a 3m chaser - David Casey, assistant trainer

runners.spotlight: Wide-margin course maiden hurdle winner on heavy in February; ran in three Grade 1s, tailed off in the Albert Bartlett; struggled in the Sefton; well held in fifth at this venue; two points shorter in the market than stablemate Ballygunner Castle over C&D on chasing debut, not going particularly well when falling four out; Ballygunner Castle is more appealing

stable_tour.quote: He travelled well for a long way at Punchestown on Sunday and the lack of a run probably just caught him out. I was delighted with how he ran, though, and that will set him up nicely for the rest of the season. We'll try to find another maiden hurdle for him somewhere next. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Creditable second in an event in which Argento Boy fell, Paul Townend sticks with him.
runners.name: Ballygunner Castle

quotes.race: Kettles Country House Hotel Supporting Fingal Ravens GFC Raceday Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballygunner Castle had to overcome plenty from very early. He got a good bump at the start and I nearly fell off him at the first. I had to ride him on then and I made him do plenty throughout the race. There was no hiding places and it was messy up the straight but he still pulled out again. It's the sign of a good one. He will relax better, I had him lit up to take on his hurdles early today because of what happened at the first. He'll be fine, he's learning on the job - Paul Townend, rider

runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick (two bumpers/maiden hurdle) in 2024; finished second/third in Graded races over 3m/2m4f before ending last season with a tame effort at Perth; of similar ability to Argento Boy as a hurdler, but that rival was preferred in the market when they clashed here on chasing debut; finished a creditable second after Argento Boy fell; Paul Townend sticks with him.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice sort who needed the summer to mature. I'm very happy with what he's doing at the moment and he should be a smart staying novice hurdler. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Well held in three chase starts at up to 2m4f, plenty to prove, lacks a recent outing
runners.name: Built By Ballymore

quotes.race: Punchestown Members Club From 215 Euros Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was delighted when I saw we were going to get Limerick ground again. Built By Ballymore just handles the muck so well. He might not quicken up in it but he keeps going in it. I thought his rating was high enough, but he just handles that ground better than most - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: CUBE Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Built By Ballymore is a big raw horse and will take a while to come to himself. I was happy enough where I was sitting, I kicked on two out and he will have learned loads from that - Conor Brassil, rider.

runners.spotlight: Won a maiden hurdle and a course 2m4f novice hurdle the season before last; well held in three chase starts at up to 2m4f; 134-rated hurdler, but looks flattered by his 124 chase mark.

runners.comment: Useful hurdler at his best, jumped badly and pulled up at this venue on chasing debut
runners.name: Da Capo Glory

quotes.race: EASYFIX Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Da Capo Glory had not run for five months and Daragh knows him very well having won a bumper and maiden hurdle on him. We couldn't look past him with his 7lb claim on that ground, which is worth its weight in gold. This horse was my first winner, he is still flying the flag and is a mighty horse. He isn't big, but is very well-bred and jumps hurdles very well - Paudie Butler, trainer

quotes.race: Oak Lodge Landscapes At Punchestown Hurdle
quotes.quote: Da Capo Glory is a lovely horse and he got a lovely ride here. He can hit flat spots in his races but he stays very well. We might aim him for the Grimes Hurdle at Tipperary next - Padraig Butler, trainer.

quotes.race: Goresbridge Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Da Capo Glory will be a lovely horse over two miles or two and a half miles going forward. We might run him in a novice in about a month. I'll discuss it with the syndicate and make a plan - Paudie Butler, trainer

runners.spotlight: Most recent of three hurdle wins was in a 2m4f Cork handicap in January 2024; early faller at Galway in October on first run after a long layoff; jumped badly and pulled up when making belated chasing debut in C&D race in which Ballygunner Castle was second.

runners.comment: Fair fifth on chasing debut, failed to build on that at Fairyhouse, may need more time
runners.name: Goraibhmaithagat
runners.spotlight: 1-4 over hurdles and rated 130; stayed on for a 20l fifth behind the smart Irish Panther on chase debut in a 2m contest at Naas; failed to build on that when raised in trip at Fairyhouse; has time on his side, but it looks as if he may need more of it.

runners.comment: Placed over hurdles, struggled on chase debut at Galway, huge price when pulled up at Naas
runners.name: Hello Jack
runners.spotlight: Placed in three maiden hurdle outings; struggled on chase debut at Galway, huge price when pulled up at Naas.

stable_tour.quote: Started over fences at Galway on Sunday and the experience won't be lost on him. He would have learnt plenty and he's probably one for a handicaps down the line. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Twice runner-up over fences, below his best in a 2m hurdle at this venue on latest
runners.name: Jigoro

quotes.race: Mervyn Gray Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a good performance from Jigoro and we knew he had improved plenty from the first day. Obviously there was a lot of talk about Tom Cooper's horse and I thought it was a good performance. Jack was delighted with him and said he'll stay further. He said a faster gallop would have suited him but he was very happy with the run. He could go for the four-year-old hurdle at Limerick over Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner; has run well in defeat at times in good races; second on his first two starts over fences, remote seventh behind Kopek Des Bordes at Navan last month; a long way below his best in a 2m hurdle at this venue on latest.

stable_tour.quote: His form tailed off a bit in the spring, but he had put up some decent performances before that. He's going novice chasing and could be a dark horse . He's better than you've seen so far. 28-10-24

runners.comment: 134-rated hurdler, not at the same level as a chaser, needs to brush up his jumping
runners.name: My Trump Card

quotes.race: QuinnBet Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: My Trump Card was sent on early enough today but he was just idling in front. He's probably more of a chaser than a hurdler. When he met a hurdle right today he was good, if he didn't he didn't pay them much respect. He might head for the Albert Bartlett - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 134-rated hurdler but last season was disappointing, including two attempts at chasing when jumping was an issue; made a serious blunder two out on seasonal return at Navan; struggled at the same venue early this month.

stable_tour.quote: He isn't straightforward. His work has always been good but he hasn't delivered on that promise we've seen at home. Chasing hasn't gone to plan for him and we'll have to decide whether to give it another go or keep him over hurdles. It would be nice to get a clean run with him this season. He's got ability. 26-10-25

runners.comment: 131-rated hurdler, latecomer to chasing, making debut on the eve of official 10th birthday
runners.name: Pray Tell

quotes.race: Singletons Supervalu Stayers Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Pray Tell is a good horse and he has such a heart. He has been plagued with injuries but the last two years have been good. We have in him now since January and he could do with a few weeks on grass - Des Kenneally, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pray Tell had good form. I was worried about the trip, I dropped him back a lot, but I said I'd take a chance. He won well, he's a lovely horse. We might go for another hurdle, we'll see how he comes out of this - Des Kenneally, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Progressive hurdler in the first half of last season, winning a maiden at Kilbeggan and a handicap at Listowel before a career-best in winning 3m Grade 3 novice at Cork in December (soft); struggled in a Grade 1 next time; has failed to find his form in handicaps since then; 131-rated hurdler makes chasing debut on the eve of official 10th birthday

runners.comment: Four wins in points, course hurdles winner, tailed off here when Ballygunner Castle second
runners.name: Prophets Corner

quotes.race: David Trundley Artist At Punchestown Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's my first winner on the track, I've had 24 in point-to-points. Prophet's Corner is a yard favourite and three miles is his thing. Once the ground gets into heavy territory, he's very good on it. He can go the same speed on soft as he can on hard. Darragh [jockey] is my brother, we keep it in-house and keep the costs down - Sean Allen, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four wins in points; won a 2m7f course handicap hurdle last winter; fell on chase debut at Listowel; ran well when sent back over hurdles in a 3m Clonmel handicap; tailed off on latest in the race in which Ballygunner Castle was second

runners.comment: 2024 Supreme Novices winner, second all three starts over fences, should win if he stays
runners.name: Slade Steel

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was always travelling. I didn't really want to be in front jumping the last, but Slade Steel kind of took me there and battled back so well after the last. I knew I had a really good chance coming into the race. He's a really, really tough horse with a massive future. He battled back really well and I think he won with a little bit [in hand] as well. It was a really good performance. He's progressing all the time. They're two very good horses, the first and second - Rachael Blackmore, jockey, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Tote Navan Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Slade Steel as it was tough work. We'd always hoped he'd be a better horse on nicer ground and he'd definitely have a preference for it, so it's great to see him get through that and get the job done. Rachael was happy and said he idled a little bit in front. He's progressing which is lovely. I don't think he needs to go up to an extreme distance, he's got plenty of gears and he won a bumper well. There is the Dublin Racing Festival, although you might have to drop back or go up further there - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Home Builders Supporting St Marys GAA Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Slade Steel was a nice bumper horse last year and it's great to see him come out and do that. He really stayed at it well, he has a bit of pace too and is a nice horse - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won 2024 Supreme Novices'; beaten odds-on favourite but showed decent form in two beginners' chases last season, notably when chasing home subsequent Brown Advisory winner Lecky Watson at Naas; off for a year before second to Predators Glory at Navan; stylish point winner in 2022; all three chase starts at around 2m4f; will be hard to beat if he stays this far.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Supreme two seasons ago and, although he didn't win, the form of his two chase runs last season looks very good. He just looked a little bit slow over his fences. He's schooling well now, so hopefully he'll be better this season. He seems in great form and we'll aim for a beginners' chase in the next few weeks. 11-11-25

He won his point-to-point and we expected him to run well on his rules debut, which he did when winning a Punchestown bumper in December. He's doing well and we'll look to run him next back at Punchestown. 01-03-23

13:05.race_name: Tote Guarantee, Never Beaten By SP Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Hard to assess on form in beginners' chases, may now find his level in handicap company
runners.name: Born Braver
runners.spotlight: 2-4 over hurdles; hard to assess on form in beginners' chases; may now find his level in handicap company; 7lb below his 129 hurdles mark.

runners.breeder: M Larkin, T Monaghan & Mabaki Inv Uc
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in two runs over fences this season, down 11lb from career-high mark
runners.name: Walnut Beach

quotes.race: Paddy Power Play Paddy's Pick 5 For Free Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Walnut Beach is a lovely horse. He is a bit lazy on the Flat but he's decent over hurdles and he can go chasing too - Pat Flynn, trainer

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Walnut Beach did it very well. He had two nice runs over hurdles, he wasn't beaten far on his first start at Roscommon and was just touched off last time - Shane Fitzgerald, rider.

runners.spotlight: Two chase wins; now 2lb lower than the mark from which he won a Killarney Listed handicap chase in 2024. and down 11lb from career-high mark; however, he has been mostly out of form in 2025; soundly beaten in two runs over fences this season.

runners.comment: Poor fifth in this race last year, pulled up in his last two races, hard to be confident
runners.name: Noble Talent
runners.spotlight: Poor fifth in this race last year; pulled up in his last two races; hard to be confident against that background.

runners.comment: Three-time course winner, latest win was here in June, next run may have come too soon
runners.name: Hardwired

quotes.race: K-Mech Mechanical Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That's Hardwired's third win around Punchestown and he's won five now with five different jockeys. He gave him a great ride and is some value for 3lb. He didn't travel well and was hunting him several times. He's a tricky ride and a hard horse to win on - Ted Walsh, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilberry Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: In fairness Hardwired stayed at it well. He looked beat going to the last, but kept at it well. He's won over 2m6f and three miles, and he saw it out well. From being a frustrating horse he's now won four. He had a good pilot on board - Ted Walsh, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three-time course winner, latest win was here in June; next run may have come too soon, only eight days later, unplaced at Kilbeggan.

runners.comment: Winning favourite at Naas on seasonal debut, fair chance of defying 11lb rise
runners.name: Crecora Hills
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler; modest chase form until exploiting a mark 7lb below his hurdles rating to land a gamble at Naas on seasonal debut; further progress is feasible; has a fair chance of defying 11lb rise.

runners.comment: Now 0-11 over fences after Navan fourth, stable's brilliant form is the main positive
runners.name: Big Stage
runners.spotlight: Now 0-11 over fences after Navan fourth; has plenty to find with Casey West on previous Fairyhouse running; cheekpieces added; stable's brilliant form is the main positive.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a wind op since you saw him last and I think there could be a nice handicap chase in him off his current mark. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Weak form in two races over fences, owner seems to have two others with a better chance
runners.name: Dont Tell Jack
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle form for Joseph O'Brien included third in a 2m event at this venue; weak form in two races over fences, owner seems to have better chances with Crecora Hills and Three In A Row.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs Stephen Oflynn & John M Flynn
runners.comment: Course winner over hurdles, modest chase form, handicap debut off 12lb below hurdles mark
runners.name: Fenway Park

quotes.race: Punchestown Home Of Irish Jumps Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fenway Park was quite professional. I was a little bit worried when the second horse came to him, I thought we were in trouble, but he pulled it out again to be fair to him. He'll be a nice horse when he goes chasing - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Course maiden hurdle for Gavin Cromwell in May 2024; modest chase form; handicap debut off 12lb below hurdles mark; could feature if a new headgear combination does the trick.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well when fourth at Punchestown before winning his maiden hurdle back there in May. He'll probably go for a handicap at Navan this week. He's summered well and we're happy with him. 12-11-24
He ran well when fourth at Punchestown before winning his maiden hurdle there in May. He'll probably go for a handicap at Navan this week. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Gained back-to-back wins in January; huge improvement needed from a Cork hurdles outing
runners.name: Dont Talk

quotes.race: SBK Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Don't Talk jumped and travelled well and the soft ground seemed to bring out a bit of improvement in him - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote+ Pays You More At Tote.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Don't Talk brought me to the front soon enough but I had to go when I did. Hopefully there is a bit more in him, he was just doing the bare minimum in front - Danny Gilligan, rider

runners.spotlight: Gained back-to-back wins at Down Royal and Fairyhouse in January; huge improvement needed from a Cork hurdles outing.

runners.comment: Hunter chase winner, comes into reckoning following an improved display at Fairyhouse
runners.name: Casey West

quotes.race: Rathronan Maiden Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Casey West is a better horse going left-handed I think. The plan was to get him qualified for Aintree and I think that's done now. He'll go back pointing before then - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Hunter chase winner; comes into reckoning following an improved display that saw him finish second at Fairyhouse a month ago; jumped well on that occasion.

runners.comment: 22-race maiden, limited chasing experience, nothing to suggest a breakthrough is imminent
runners.name: Attaboyarchie
runners.spotlight: 22-race maiden, limited chasing experience; nothing to suggest a breakthrough is imminent.

runners.comment: Clear of the third when second to a well-handicapped horse on seasonal debut, good chance
runners.name: Sammy Smart
runners.spotlight: Course handicap hurdle winner over 3m late last year; also ran well here in January; clear of the third when second to the well-handicapped Rising Dust (8l winner on his most recent start) on seasonal debut at Thurles; good prospect with normal improvement.

runners.comment: Sole win over hurdles was at this venue in January 2024, otherwise hard to make a case
runners.name: Silver King

quotes.race: Book Your Festival Hospitality Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Silver King was good today and he will stay over hurdles now. He had a bad experience here over fences last time and I decided that was enough. We are very happy with that and hopefully the horses are coming back to themselves - Oliver McKiernan, trainer

runners.spotlight: Sole win from 20 attempts came over hurdles at this venue in January almost two years ago (2m4f, soft); 0-10 chasing and tended to struggle in chase starts last season; pulled up at Navan in March; fell at the first at Wexford on return.

runners.comment: Beaten 7l in fourth behind the same owner's Crecora Hills at Naas, out of the money since
runners.name: Three In A Row
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler; useful form over fences towards the end of last season, third at Limerick and second at Kilbeggan; a long way below his best at Killarney in May; beaten 7l in fourth behind the same owner's Crecora Hills at Naas; out of the money at Clonmel early this month.

runners.comment: Won a beginners' chase at Wexford in 2024, mostly ordinary form since then, up against it
runners.name: Bocellis Voice
runners.spotlight: Won a beginners' chase at Wexford in 2024 but mixed form since; best run came back at that track in August and needs a return to his top form.

runners.comment: Won over 3m1f in 2023, ran only once last year, should be better for a point-to-point run
runners.name: North Of Nashville
runners.spotlight: Won over 3m1f at Wexford in 2023; ran only once last year; should be better for a point-to-point run in a three-runner Lisronagh contest won by prolific winner The Great Unknown; not a forlorn hope off this mark if she can recapture form.

13:35.race_name: Celebrate The New Year With Tote 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Two Flat wins, rated 76 at season's end, could feature with a clean round of jumping.
runners.name: Blue Moon Boy
runners.spotlight: Much improved to win a Galway festival maiden over an extended 1m (good-to-yielding); gained a second success when upped in trip at Killarney in October, asserting late over 1m3f (soft); down the field at Galway on final outing; rated 76 at season's end; could feature with a clean round of jumping.

runners.comment: Best watched in a race in which stablemates Wackestone and Immediate Effect are preferred
runners.name: Direct Approach

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs A M Obrien

runners.spotlight: Three runs in Flat maidens for Donnacha O'Brien; gave an improved display when 6l second over a near-1m2f trip on heavy at Gowran in September; best watched in a race in which stablemates Wackestone and Immediate Effect have stronger credentials.

runners.comment: No sign of ability on the Flat, towards the rear at Fairyhouse on hurdling debut
runners.name: Folk Warrior
runners.spotlight: No sign of ability in three Curragh outings at different trips; towards the rear at Fairyhouse on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Won twice on AW for Sir Mark Prescott, stablemate Wackestone has jumping experience
runners.name: Immediate Effect
runners.spotlight: Won twice on AW for Sir Mark Prescott (7f and 1m); placed in three of his five runs on turf; unplaced in two 1m2f handicaps at Doncaster on final two starts before 45,000gns sale to join Gordon Elliott; could make a useful hurdler; Jack Kennedy's mount Wackestone has jumping experience on his side.

runners.breeder: Chapel Lane Farm L T D
runners.comment: Has shown next to nothing in two Fairyhouse runs, badly hampered four out last time
runners.name: John Dixen
runners.spotlight: Never in contention and pulled up before two out on debut at Fairyhouse; badly hampered four out at the same venue on second attempt and soon tailed off.

runners.comment: Mild promise in two runs over hurdles, will probably need to obtain a handicap mark
runners.name: Minella Boss
runners.spotlight: Rated 65 after four runs on the Flat for John Nallen; has shown signs of ability in two runs over hurdles; will probably need to obtain a handicap mark.

runners.comment: Won over just short of 1m4f in France, runner-up won over hurdles at Pau on Christmas Eve
runners.name: Mino Des Mottes
runners.spotlight: Ran twice in AQPS races during the summer; unseated rider on the first occasion; raced keenly on second outing when led after a couple of furlongs and made the rest for a hard-earned win over a trip just short of 1m4f on good-to-soft; runner-up was an odds-on chance and was good enough to win over hurdles at Pau on Christmas Eve.

stable_tour.quote: A Gigginstown recruit from the Flat who should evolve into a nice juvenile hurdler. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Weak form on Flat, jumping was untidy when tailed off on hurdling debut at Limerick
runners.name: Padre Bay
runners.spotlight: Ex-Godolphin; weak form in three starts on the Flat, including on stable debut at Dundalk; jumping was untidy when tailed off on hurdling debut at Limerick five days ago.

runners.breeder: Lynch Bages Ltd & Camas Park Stud
runners.comment: Won over 1m6f for Ballydoyle, half-brother to Capri and to Fred Winter winner Brazil
runners.name: Saratoga

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.spotlight: Ex-Ballydoyle; placed in three maidens before handicap win over 1m6f on heavy at Listowel; fifth of 20 in a 2m premier handicap at Naas; completely out of his depth in 2m Group 1 at Ascot; half-brother to high-class Capri and Tower Of London, and more relevant in this context, to Brazil, who beat Gaelic Warrior in the 2022 Fred Winter for this owner/trainer combination.

runners.comment: Not a likely debut winner over hurdles on the evidence of four Flat starts for Ger Lyons
runners.name: Stone Rulya
runners.spotlight: Not a likely debut winner over hurdles on the evidence of four Flat starts for Ger Lyons.

runners.comment: Probably does not need to improve much from Fairyhouse and and Navan run to score here
runners.name: Wackestone
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat maiden (rated 80); made a couple of mistakes when a beaten favourite in fourth on his hurdling debut at Ballinrobe; showed a tendency to jump to the right when third behind his shorter-priced stablemate Barbizon at Navan; failed to reverse the form of that race with the useful Ben Hur when second at Fairyhouse 18 days ago.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't jump well at Ballinrobe but he's been schooling much better at home and I think you'll see an improved effort when he reappears in a juvenile maiden hurdle. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Best Flat run a second over 2m1f at Pontefract, best watched on Irish and hurdling debut.
runners.name: Louies Folly
runners.spotlight: Placed over 2m1f at Pontefract on the fifth of six Flat starts in Britain; best watched on Irish and hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Weak form on the Flat, the same in her first three starts over hurdles, can be ruled out.
runners.name: Real Petite
runners.spotlight: Weak form on the Flat; the same in her first three starts over hurdles; can be ruled out.

14:05.race_name: Make The Tote App Your New Year's Resolution NYE Hurdle

runners.comment: Five wins in France, faces a big task at these weights and lacks a recent outing
runners.name: Aint Got Wings
runners.spotlight: Five wins in France, three over fences, two over hurdles; only five starts since 2022, but two of his chase wins came last season after a long absence; has to concede weight to all seven rivals, and the lack of a recent outing may count against him

runners.comment: Smart hurdler, three wins and twice placed in the Coral Cup, has warmed up with an AW run
runners.name: Ballyadam

quotes.race: Coral Cup Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ballyadam loves it here every time. He is a star in his own right. He is another year older, but he just keeps on giving. In fairness his worst enemy is the handicapper. He loves running here and running fresh so we are delighted. The key to him is keeping him fresh - Chris Richardson, racing manager to Cheveley Park stud.

quotes.race: Coral Cup Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a savage run. We were giving away plenty of weight unfortunately, but fair play to the winner. Ballyadam is so consistent and turns up every day, here at Cheltenham in particular - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: BARONERACING.COM Royal Bond Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: From the last home, it was just hands and heels. Jack [Kennedy] said he gave him one little flick and there was still plenty of horse left there. But he is still a baby and has a lot of learning to do. He found plenty for pressure. He is a tough horse and he stays as well, and he is relaxed now as well. He was very keen in his bumpers when he was young. We'll discuss it, but I'd imagine he will head to Leopardstown over Christmas now - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Ballyadam

quotes.race: Tayto Group Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballyadam is a fair horse. He was sprinting at the second last and would have won a lot further if he jumped the last. He probably learned more from that mistake than anything else. He could go for the Royal Bond next - Gordon Elliott, trainer

runners.spotlight: Smart hurdler, also a winning chaser; three wins over hurdles; placed in the Coral Cup in 2024 (second to Langer Dan) and last season, when third behind the 5lb-receiving Jimmy Du Seuil; third in a 1m4f AW maiden five weeks ago; should be well primed for his bid to repeat last year's win in this event when the outsider of three against a Willie Mullins-trained pair.

stable_tour.quote: He ran great when third in the Coral Cup last season - we were delighted with him. He'll run in the next few weeks, and then we'll aim towards the spring, I'd say. He could potentially go back to the Coral Cup, but we'll see. 11-11-25

He has had only one run this winter when a very good third to Gaelic Warrior in the valuable Liffey Handicap Hurdle at the Dublin Racing Festival. He has entries in the County Hurdle and the Coral Cup and he'll go for one of them. His best trip is probably 2m and that points to the County, where he was a good fifth to State Man last year, but we'll make a decision closer to the time. 01-03-23

runners.comment: Odds-on C&D winner in October, set tough tasks in two Grade 1s, place chance
runners.name: Glen Kiln

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Steel Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Glen Kiln is a smashing horse. I said to Michael [Bowe, owner] quietly in the stable beforehand that hopefully we'll be here for the Grand National this time next year. Michael and John and all the family are here today and I'm delighted for them and to get an opportunity to have a decent horse on a big day, it's fantastic. Cian is a fantastic young jockey and hopefully he gets the opportunities - Harry Kelly, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Glen Kiln schooled last week over fences at Tipperary and we were going to go for a beginners chase but the ground was nicer here, he wants soft ground. All the conditions were right for him. We love him, he's a horse for the future - John Bowe, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Supporting Kill GAA Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Glen Kiln got a super ride. He galloped away and used his stamina. We told Carl not to let it turn into a sprint. He'll make a great chaser - Michael Bowe, owner

runners.spotlight: Signed off last season with a 2m6f handicap win at Fairyhouse; looked set for victory when dislodging his rider with a mistake at the last in a 2m Grade 3 event at Tipperary in October; odds-on C&D winner nine days later; did well to finish second of four behind Lossiemouth in the Morgiana Hurdle; beaten when unseating at the last in the Hatton's Grace; place chance here.

runners.comment: Two Flat wins in 2020 for Andre Fabre; highly tried by Willie Mullins, off since June 2023
runners.name: Bring On The Night

quotes.race: Festival Trials Day Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Bring On The Night had a setback last year and we really had to run him here to see if was good enough to go to Cheltenham. He was green to jump and we think he will improve a fair bit from that - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two Flat wins in 2020 in France for Andre Fabre; joined Willie Mullins and contested Grade 1 novice hurdles in 2022 after a Naas maiden win; second in the 2m4f Ascot Stakes later that year, not seen since unplaced favourite for the same race in 2023; now with James Nash.

stable_tour.quote: He ran at Royal Ascot and, coincidentally, got injured again. It was the same story last year. It was only a small injury but he's missed a bit of time. He's back in pre-training now but you won't see him for another little while. 13-11-23

runners.comment: A superb 2m novice chaser at his peak, plagued by jumping frailties, this test could suit
runners.name: El Fabiolo

quotes.race: BoyleSports Webster Cup Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo was very free and he will improve for that. He wants nicer ground and we'll look at Aintree for him. He's not going to Cheltenham - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Celebration Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo has run a cracker to get back up for second. He was a bit slow in the air and lost some ground but has run well - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo got very low over a few of them, I know he was a little bit chancy before, but I was very concerned, and then he jumped the last one good, but of course then he went on to the next one and just stood back too far at it and didn't get high enough. Disappointing. There was no point in Paul [Townend] going on after that and hopefully we can look at Aintree or Punchestown with him, but we'll see how he is in the next few days - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dublin Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo did his job well because Dinoblue had worked very well during the week, and I thought if he made any mistake then she would definitely give him a race. He was very clean today and very good. Paul just sat very quiet on him, and he appreciated that and did his job. I'm delighted and Mark was very happy with the mare too - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hilly Way Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo got the job done, but he wasn't flashy. I think he'll improve hugely. He ran too free early on but once he turned down the back Paul led him on and he relaxed a bit more. He got a breather then and he needed that because Jack Kennedy was behind him and ready to test him.It's very close to Christmas and we might just go to Ascot like we've done previously for the Clarence House - Trainer Willie Mullins speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo looks a two-miler all over, but we'll see. I'd have no problem going two and a half as he's nice and relaxed. He's improving all the time and it's always nice having those two-mile chasers and it's good to have something coming behind Energumene. Over the first couple of fences he was a bit rusty for whatever reason, but hopefully as he races more, Paul might get more confidence into him, but he's doing nothing too wrong at the moment. You feel Paul is always pulling him back and trying to keep a lid on, which he was until the second-last and then he decided to let him go - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo travelled as well as we were hoping he would the whole way and Paul (Townend) said he hit a flat spot down the back somewhere, but then when he picked him up he came alive under him and he was very happy until pecking at the last. I'm not looking to up him in trip yet. If a horse can operate over two miles they are easier to train, easier to keep sound, and just easy altogether. I'm hoping he can stay at that trip and hopefully he will be a Champion Chase horse down the road - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Irish Arkle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: At the start of the year we were thinking maybe we should go out to two-and-a-half but what El Fabiolo did at Christmas and again today it's definitely the Arkle - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was only the third run of his life and El Fabiolo got a little bit of interference after the third-last. We don't know whether it cost him the race or not but Paul certainly had to use up petrol to get back into it. We were very happy with his run, he was beaten by a good horse. We're looking forward to his novice chasing career. He got two little nicks, one on each front leg. He might get to Punchestown, we'll see - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: David Flynn Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo is a nice recruit for Simon Munir and Isaac Souede. He shows me plenty at home and Paul said he was going easy at all stages. He does everything easy at home and showed me the same here. He's up there with all of those [Penhill, Saint Roi and Laurina, who all win maiden hurdles at this track] - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: An outstanding 2m novice chaser at his peak; plagued by jumping frailties since pulled up in the 2024 Champion Chase; made a series of mistakes before falling in last season's Melling Chase; fell again here in April; 2-4 over hurdles, course 2m winner; this test could suit if his hurdling technique is adequate.

stable_tour.quote: He was bang there when coming down two out in the Champion Chase at Punchestown. I thought he was running a very big race at the time. We'll follow a similar sort of route with him this season and I doubt you'll see him before Christmas. Hopefully he can get his jumping together when he does return. 17-11-25

On his second run for us he was only beaten a neck by Jonbon over hurdles in his own backyard, whereas we had to travel. This season he's had two runs over fences and impressed each time, particularly when winning the Irish Arkle last month. That was a very deep race and I knew it would be tough but for him to jump the way he did and come away like that he's a serious horse. I suppose looking at the rematch with Jonbon in the Arkle it depends who has improved the most over the winter months and our horse seems to have come on a huge amount. He has to have a serious chance. 08-03-23

runners.comment: Out of form since landing a staying handicap at Haydock 13 months ago, unlikely to feature
runners.name: Shoot First

quotes.race: Betfair Stayers' Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: "It was a great training performance by Charles [Byrnes] as Shoot First came on from the last day following a two-year break. He's still a big raw baby and he pricked his ears when we hit the front, so stepping up in grade he's going to be even better. That was his first time on soft ground and he relished it. He's an exciting horse. Alex Harvey, jockey.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shoot First likes the slight bit of ease in the ground and he travelled and jumped well - if anything he possibly got there a bit soon. He nearly threw it away after the last. It [Pertemps Final] would be the obvious one [target]. I think he'd get in now - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Town Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shoot First was getting 8lb and it made a big difference. They went a good, honest gallop and he stayed well - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Gained his third hurdles win when landing a big staying handicap at Haydock 13 months ago; lost way since and has fallen on two of his last four starts; soundly beaten third of five in a conditions race at Clonmel last time.

runners.comment: High-class chaser, didn't exploit 33lb lower hurdles mark in a handicap at Naas last month
runners.name: Spillanes Tower

quotes.race: John Durkan Memorial Punchestown Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely over the moon with Spillane's Tower. He hasn't been on grass since he won here at the festival. We couldn't, the ground has just been too firm. We have everything to look forward to now. Without a doubt that's the best race I've ever been involved in. You couldn't get any better - Jimmy Mangan, trainer.

quotes.race: Dooley Insurance Group Champion Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Spillane's Tower is a special horse to us. We're dreaming now, he has something special about him. He is the most relaxed and easy horse and got a beautiful and cool ride - Jimmy Mangan, trainer

quotes.race: WillowWarm Gold Cup (Chase) (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted for Jimmy [Mangan, trainer] especially because he hasn't had a good horse in a while. When he gets a good horse like that he's well able to do the job. I was keeping my powder dry as I didn't want to be in front too soon but I had to go with the gallop they were going and, to be fair, Spillane's Tower jumped well. I'm delighted and he's one to look forward to - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Betting Better With SkyBet Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Spillane's Tower was helped by the step up in trip and he stayed well. All of his runs have been good and he is improving all the time - Frank Berry, racing manager to J.P. McManus.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Spillane's Tower had two great runs and he delivered today. It turned into a sprint, we would have preferred a good gallop, but he has that little bit of class - Jimmy Mangan, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Supporting Kill GAA Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Spillane's Tower is a nice horse and he will be better next year. He needed the trip and that ground is probably as quick as he would want it. A Summer's grass will do him the world of good - Jimmy Mangan, trainer

runners.spotlight: Won two Grade 1s as a novice chaser, including over 3m1f this venue; second in 2m4f John Durkan here last season; blundered four out when remote second to Galopin Des Champs here in May; failed to run to expectations when trying to exploit 33lb lower hurdles mark at Naas last month; should go close if he hurdles economically.

runners.comment: Won a 2m Grade 3 over 2m at Gowran in February 2024, needs to find her form again
runners.name: Lantry Lady

quotes.race: Close Brothers Mares' Hurdle (Registered As The David Nicholson Mares' Hurdle) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Langtry Lady is the one for the future, definitely. That was only her third start and Jack (Kennedy) said she just got a little bit lost at the start. She's probably a three-mile mare in time, so I'm delighted - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Red Mills Trial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Lantry Lady is a really nice mare and I'm delighted for the Marigas as they are great supporters of ours. She was impressive here last year in her maiden hurdle and then we put her away as she was a bit immature. I was concerned about fitness and that it was only her second run after winning a maiden hurdle, but she's obviously stepped forward again.   Cheltenham has to be a possibility and we'd love to go. It would be a step up in trip, but she suggests at home that all she does is stay. I'd say she definitely wants a good ease in the ground so we'd be cautious of that - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Best Of Luck To The Irish At Cheltenham Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lantry Lady was a mare we liked a lot at home. I thought she would need the run but she looked good. I thought she lacked the experience to win but that was very good. She probably needs a nice ease in the ground - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 7yo; won a 2m Grade 3 over 2m at Gowran in February 2024; creditable fourth in the Mares' hurdle at Cheltenham following that; ran only twice last season; poor run when favourite for a beginners' chase at Gowran on seasonal debut.

stable_tour.quote: She's been disappointing in her two chase runs and I think we'll go back over hurdles. She just doesn't seem to enjoy jumping fences. 11-11-25

runners.comment: French chase winner, disappointing stable debut, may have needed that, can do better
runners.name: Klass Langy
runners.owner: Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah
runners.spotlight: Chase winner in France was sent off favourite at Cheltenham for his stable debut but was always behind and never got involved; may have needed that and surely capable of better.

runners.comment: Limerick maiden hurdle winner, likely to improve for handicap debut latest, chance
runners.name: Sommesky

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (Pro/Am) Auction INH Flat Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Sommesky quickened really well. We increased the pace plenty early and he did it well in the end. He has a lovely attitude and handled that ground well - John Gleeson, rider.

runners.spotlight: Limerick maiden hurdle winner (2m3f, soft) last Christmas was highly tried to no avail subsequently; not a bad run on seasonal return and handicap debut at Naas in November and likely to improve for that; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He was a nice bumper winner last season at Limerick and we're looking forward to getting him out. We're struggling against the ground with him as he wants it soft, but he's a nice prospect. 18-11-24

runners.comment: Best hurdles form at around 2m-2m1f, not much impact on Flat this year, others more solid
runners.name: Toto Too

quotes.race: Treo Eile Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Toto Too coped with the ground and got through it well. He jumped well apart from the second-last and that will improve him. He will need more experience but he could potentially be a Galway Hurdle horse - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Guaranteed Multiples All Shops Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Toto Too is a lovely horse. He schooled well at home and I was keen to get him out on nice ground, but he can mix on softer ground heading into the winter. He could develop into a nice novice hurdler - Peter Fahey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bumper and two-time hurdle winner at around 2m-2m1f; no real impact on the Flat since joining this yard and has stamina to prove for this trip on return to hurdling; others look more solid.

runners.comment: Top class bumper performer, brought down early on h'cap debut, could be well treated
runners.name: A Dream To Share

quotes.race: Race & Stay At Punchestown Champion I.N.H. Flat Race (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: A Dream To Share is a great horse to keep his form for so long. He had to dig deep at the end, the second is a very good horse, but John is a strong man for his age. He did very well. The races all came at an ideal distance apart for him. The space between Leopardstown, Cheltenham and here suited him very well. He'll get a nice holiday now - John Kiely, trainer.

quotes.race: Shabra Charity Oliver Brady Memorial Future Stars (C & G) I.N.H. Flat Race (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I didn't know what to expect to be honest because we haven't that much to work A Dream To Share with but we always liked him - John Kiely, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Top class bumper performer and 1m5f Flat maiden winner is 0-4 over timber; brought down early on handicap debut at Fairyhouse last month; could be well handicapped off this mark and can't be discounted.

runners.comment: No win since Grade 2 success in 2022, pulled up on latest, risky proposition
runners.name: No Looking Back

quotes.race: Coolmore NH Sires Kew Gardens Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I'm surprised but it's brilliant. No Looking Back was a bit of an unknown after winning in Thurles. He's a horse that Oliver and the team have loved. Johnny Barry has always thought lots of him and he proved him right today. When I quickened him he picked up over the last, and hopefully he can progress again. He landed running and galloped to the line. You'd have to be surprised going from a maiden to open company - Phillip Enright, jockey

quotes.race: Thurles Racecourse Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: No Looking Back won his bumper in similar fashion here. He didn't do a pile when he hit the front but he had to get there. His jumping was okay but he will be sharper the next day - Oliver McKiernan, trainer.

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: No Looking Back surprised me, because when I walked the track I didn't think it was soft enough. He'll be heading to Fairyhouse for the big sales bumper there. I wasn't expecting him to win there but delighted he did - Oliver McKiernan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a Grade 2 in 2022 but has mostly struggled since; pulled up on seasonal return at Fairyhouse a month ago; mark sliding but remains a risky proposition.

runners.comment: Only seen twice since last win in 2023, may have needed the run latest, place shout
runners.name: Thornleigh Frank
runners.spotlight: Progressive in 2023 but only seen twice since winning at Galway in August of that year; shaped as though the run was needed on first start for this stable at Fairyhouse latest and should come on for that; place shout if building on that.

runners.comment: Up 7lb for course win penultimate, struggled at Naas latest, return to this track a plus
runners.name: Linden Arden

quotes.race: Corrib Oil Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Linden Arden flicked off the ground and hopefully he can keep progressing. We knew we had a good jumper on our hands and he was so good today - Brian Hayes, rider.

runners.spotlight: Exploited lower hurdles mark on debut for this yard here in October (20.5f, gd-yld), his second win at this venue; raised 7lb and struggled in a Listed handicap hurdle at Naas last month; return to this venue a plus and still 5lb below chase mark.

runners.comment: Form of latest second at Navan franked, has won at this trip, go well again off 2lb higher
runners.name: Theflyingbee
runners.spotlight: Excellent effort at Navan latest (2m, sft-hvy) when a 2.5l runner up behind Spinola Bay who won again off 8lb higher at Leopardstown last week; has won at this trip and should go well again off 2lb higher.

runners.comment: Wexford maiden hurdle winner in 2023, off since September 2024, watch unless market speaks
runners.name: Boher Road

quotes.race: FEXCO Handicap
quotes.quote: Boher Road is thriving. I was very happy the whole way round and showed here that he was very versatile. I couldn't believe how far clear he was at the line, he loved the track - Ronan Whelan, rider

quotes.race: Hollywoodbets Supports Brentford Football Club Maiden
quotes.quote: Boher Road is a nice horse and has improved with every run. We knew we had the form in the book to be there or thereabouts today. Ronan gave him a great ride, he could have done with a bit more cover but it just didn't work out. Ronan says he'll go further so hopefully when he learns his job he'll do that - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Wexford maiden hurdle winner in 2023; ran out when clear on last start over hurdles at Fairyhouse in April 2024; off since finishing down the field in the 2024 Irish Cesarewitch; best watched on return unless the market speaks.

runners.comment: Raised 6lb for Cork win on penultimate, struggled over C&D latest, needs to rebound
runners.name: Cafe Con Leche
runners.owner: Anthony David Bustin & Paul Mc Kernan & Aisling Mccarthy

quotes.race: Follow Limerick Racecourse On Facebook Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cafe Con Leche has got a lot stronger and he is more effective in a finish now than he used to be. He's an improver, he's developing, and it was probably a blessing in disguise that he didn't get into the Boodles - Denis Hogan, trainer/rider

quotes.race: Rosegreen Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cafe Con Leche just followed the favourite before that one just stopped. He was rated to win this. He's quite versatile as to ground. We might just take our time with him for now - Denis Hogan, trainer-rider

runners.spotlight: Won his fifth race over hurdles at Cork (2m4f, yielding) early last month; raised 6lb and struggled over this C&D on latest (sft-hvy); needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Won this in 2023 off 13lb lower, not a bad run on seasonal return latest, not dismissed
runners.name: Catch The Beast
runners.spotlight: Won this race by 10l in 2023 on heavy ground off 13lb lower; no joy since but didn't run too badly when beaten 15l into sixth at Naas on seasonal reappearance last month; should improve for that and not dismissed.

runners.comment: C&D maiden hurdle winner, ran well here in October (gd-yld), may need quicker ground
runners.name: Rockymountainbleu

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rockymountainbeau had a good run in a point-to-point and his work at home has been good. We knew he'd be competitive but didn't know whether he needed the run but he did it well. It will sharpen him up a lot as he was looking for a bit of company - Tiernan Power Roche, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Won his maiden hurdle over C&D (good) in November 2024; best run since a 4.5l fourth in the 2m4f (gd-yld) race won by Linden Arden here in October; didn't back that up over this C&D (sft-hvy) latest; may need quicker ground than this.

runners.breeder: S A S I E I , S C E A Des Prairies, M Khalifa Mohamed Al Att
runners.comment: Maiden, good runs in defeat the last twice, yard in flying form, leading contender
runners.name: San Hilario
runners.spotlight: Maiden has shaped as though his turn was near the last twice when runner up at Fairyhouse (20.5f, yld-sft) and fourth of 19 at Navan (2m4f, sft-hvy); yard flying and he's a leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: A nice young horse who came from France and disappointed us initially on his first few starts. The break has done him good, though, and I think you'll see an improved animal when he reappears in a maiden hurdle soon. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Course winner, in the doldrums for some time, no signs of a revival recent starts
runners.name: Penny Jar

quotes.race: Kathleen Walsh Memorial Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: All Penny Jar does is stay and he kept at it well - Pat Downey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Course winner has been in the doldrums for some time and no signs of a resurgence in recent starts.

runners.comment: Handicap debutante, no show in maidens but could improve, check the market
runners.name: Dameauscottlestown
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante hasn't shown much in maidens including over C&D latest; could improve so worth a market check.

runners.comment: Lost way since maiden win last Nov', a bit better here latest but others appeal more
runners.name: Space Warrior
runners.owner: Mrs Helen Mullins & M J Lomax

quotes.race: Starting Point 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Space Warrior had schooled well, although I didn't think he will win first time. He jumped well and Danny was very good on him. I don't know what the plan is - Tom Mullins, trainer

runners.spotlight: Fairyhouse maiden last November has generally disappointed since; slightly better effort when a 14l fourth of 8 here over 2m latest in first-time blinkers (retained); dropped another 2lb but others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Promise in decent ground maidens, struggled on h'cap debut, may need sounder surface
runners.name: Build A Bridge
runners.spotlight: Mild promise in maidens at 2m3f-2m7f on decent ground; struggled on handicap debut on heavy at Clonmel; may need a sounder surface.

runners.comment: 2m Kilbeggan win in August, no impact since, beaten 11l latest, others preferred
runners.name: Im Flattered
runners.spotlight: Won off 3lb lower at Kilbeggan in August (2m, gd-yld); no impact in three starts since and beaten 11l when sixth of 16 at Clonmel last time; others preferred

runners.comment: No show in three handicaps since maiden second, lacks a recent run, a bit to prove
runners.name: Lady Bee Great
runners.spotlight: Standout effort a close second in a Tipperary maiden hurdle in May (2m1f, gd-yld); no show in three handicaps since and has been off since July; a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Dropped 2lb for 36l defeat on handicap debut at Navan, much more needed
runners.name: Goldrush Kid
runners.spotlight: Flat winner weakened late when beaten 36l on handicap hurdle debut at Navan last month (2m, sft-hvy); dropped 2lb but much more needed.

runners.comment: Good ground winner off 6lb lower at Limerick in May, soft conditions a concern here
runners.name: Midnight Eagle
runners.spotlight: Won off 6lb lower at Limerick in May (2m, good); best effort since a 5l second of 18 on similar ground at Thurles on penultimate; underfoot conditions a concern here.

runners.comment: Made respiratory noise in running on h'cap debut latest, can only be watched for now
runners.name: Scary Askari
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability but made a respiratory noise in running when soundly beaten on handicap debut at Fairyhouse last month; can only be watched for now.

runners.comment: Better effort at Sligo latest, not obviously well treated for h'cap bow, best watched
runners.name: Dunany Shore
runners.spotlight: Better effort in last of three maiden hurdle runs at Sligo (2m4f, gd-yld) when a 15l fourth of 9l; not obviously well treated for this handicap debut and ground an unknown so likely best watched.

runners.breeder: M Eric Helye & M Michel Legrand
runners.comment: 40-1 and beaten 34l on handicap debut, in good hands but others have better claims
runners.name: Laska Du Breuil
runners.spotlight: Modest form at big odds in maidens and similar story when beaten 34l at 40-1 on handicap debut at Cork last month; in good hands but others hold more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Won this last year off 11lb lower, has struggled for this yard, new visor needs to spark
runners.name: Falcon Park

quotes.race: Lisronagh Handicap Hurdle
