quotes.quote: Falcon Park is just in good humour at the moment. I've no idea why he's hitting form but he's always shown more at home than he showed at the racecourse - Paul Hennessy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Back-to-back wins for former yard included this race off 11lb lower; yet to show much since joining this stable and was pulled up at Fairyhouse latest; new visor needs to spark.

runners.comment: 0-17 over timber, not a bad effort at Fairyhouse on latest, new headgear combo tried
runners.name: Blue Reed
runners.spotlight: Twenty-two race maiden under Rules is 0-17 over timber; has run well here before and it wasn't a bad effort at Fairyhouse on latest; cheekpieces now added to usual tongue tie.

runners.comment: 0-7, failed to complete in first two handicaps, beaten when falling latest, best watched
runners.name: Bruno From Mars
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles and has failed to complete in first two handicaps; looked beaten when falling on debut for this yard at Down Royal last week; best watched.

runners.comment: Flat winner, midfield in second handicap hurdle at Down Royal last week, more needed
runners.name: Patrick Street
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner is 0-5 over timber; modest effort in both starts in handicap hurdles; midfield on latest at Down Royal last week; more needed off the same mark.

runners.comment: Handicap debutante, well beaten in maidens, may improve but hard to make case for on form
runners.name: Hello Yes
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante has finished well beaten in a trio of maidens at 2m1f-3m on good and yielding ground; could improve but not easy to make a case for on form.

runners.comment: No joy since 2021 maiden hurdle win, moderate recent form, others appeal more
runners.name: Go Gill Go

quotes.race: RSS Document Storage Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Go Gill Go ran well at Wexford over too long a trip. She saw it out well today. She will handle better ground and we will try and find a handicap hurdle somewhere - James Grace, trainer.

runners.spotlight: On losing run since Sligo maiden hurdle run in 2021; no signs of ending the barren spell in recent starts; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten at 100-1 on handicap debut latest, hard to fancy
runners.name: Miss Bella Vista
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in maidens and similar outcome when 100-1 handicap debut at Fairyhouse earlier this month; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Decent third at Tramore latest, form has been boosted, leading claims on that effort
runners.name: King Bob
runners.spotlight: First sign of promise when a 7.25l third at Tramore on latest in October (2m, yielding); 1lb lower now and the first two home in that race have boosted that form; leading claims on the back of that effort.

runners.comment: Long standing maiden, in poor form in 2025, pulled up on latest, hard to fancy
runners.name: Boston Bongo
runners.spotlight: Long standing maiden has been in poor form in 2025; pulled up on latest at Limerick last month; difficult to fancy.

15:35.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race

runners.comment: E10,000 Malinas mare, dam related to smart bumper winners, tongue tied for debut
runners.name: Auntie Ida
runners.spotlight: Malinas mare; E10,000 3yo; dam bumper and 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase winner, sister to smart bumper winner Mount Ida, half-sister to high-class bumper and 2m-3m2f hurdle/chase winner Sizing Tennessee; tongue tied for debut; yard 0-19 in bumpers last five seasons.

runners.comment: Diamond Boy mare, dam maiden hurdler, likely best watched on belated debut
runners.name: Hazy Daisy
runners.spotlight: Diamond Boy mare; dam maiden hurdler (best effort over 2m4f), closely related to useful 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase winner Rocklander and bumper/useful 2m-3m hurdle winner Rathpatric; likely best watched on belated debut.

runners.comment: Doyen mare; dam a half-sister to Kalashnikov, yard won this in 2022, check market
runners.name: Ivy Lane
runners.spotlight: Doyen mare; dam 2m4f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Kalashnikov (high-class bumper and 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase); out of sister to Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Kicking King; nicely bred and worth a market check for yard that won this in 2022.

runners.comment: Shirocco filly, half-sister to 2m7f winner, yard 2-93 in bumpers last 5 seasons, watch
runners.name: Jenina
runners.spotlight: Shirocco filly; half-sister to 2m7f chase winner Sir Carnegie; dam placed bumper, half-sister to 2m hurdle/3m chase winner Urtheoneiwant, out of half-sister to Arc winner Trempolino; yard 2-93 in bumpers last five seasons; probably best watched on debut.

runners.breeder: Mill House Stud & Mr N Farrell
runners.comment: Much improved effort when runner up at Tramore latest, place claims again
runners.name: Lilannbee
runners.spotlight: Left previous runs behind when going close at Tramore last month (2m, soft); that wasn't the deepest of races but she has place claims again, nonetheless.

runners.breeder: E A R L Les Bordes De Mornay & M Gerard Hanquiez
runners.comment: Outran odds of 25-1 on debut, yard won this with Bambino Fever last year, obvious chance
runners.name: Luciole Des Bordes
runners.spotlight: Outran her odds of 25-1 when a respectable fifth of 17 in a valuable bumper at Fairyhouse in April; off since but top yard can ready one first time out and won this with the top-class Bambino Fever last year; obvious chance.

runners.comment: Good run over C&D in October 2024, off since maiden hurdle defeat next month, check market
runners.name: Madam Jess
runners.spotlight: Ran a nice race over C&D (good) on her second start in October 2024; off since a heavy defeat in a Galway maiden hurdle the following month; needs checking in the market on return to action.

runners.comment: Shirocco mare, won a Dromahane point by 4l, form not easy to assess but has ability
runners.name: Nells Princess
runners.spotlight: Shirocco mare is a half-sister to a Rules' winner; ran out a 4l victor in a Dromahane point-to-point in November; that form isn't easy to assess but she clearly has some level of ability.

runners.comment: 80-1 and tailed off on debut at Limerick last week, seems safe to rule out after that
runners.name: Quiet In Bresil
runners.spotlight: 80-1 and tailed off in a Limerick bumper last week; seems safe to rule out on the evidence of that effort.

runners.comment: Order Of St George mare, bought for 100,000GBP after point win in 2024, check market
runners.name: Red Acres Georgie
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George mare; unraced dam from the family of Ballyburn; bought for 100,000GBP after winning a Ballindenisk point-to-point by a wide margin in May 2024; long absence since a concern but she needs checking in the market.

runners.comment: Beaten 67l on debut over C&D in Feb' 2023, off since, best watched after mammoth layoff
runners.name: Sky Lewis
runners.spotlight: Beaten 67l on debut over C&D in February 2023 and not seen since; can only be watched after mammoth absence.

runners.comment: Doyen mare, bought for 85,000GBP after point win, fascinating contender for top yard
runners.name: Sound Judgement
runners.spotlight: Doyen mare bought for 85,000GBP after an impressive point-to-point win at Monksgrange in March for champion handler Colin Bowe; has joined a top yard and is a fascinating contender on Rules' debut.

stable_tour.quote: A really lovely filly who showed a nice turn of foot to win a mares' maiden point for Colin Bowe. She'll have a mares bumper on her agenda soon. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Kingston Hill mare, well beaten in point but yard 2-2 in bumpers last 5 seasons
runners.name: The Fly Window
runners.spotlight: Kingston Hill mare soundly beaten in a Bartlemy point-to-point in May; not easy to fancy on that run but yard is 2-2 in bumpers in the last five seasons and had a maiden hurdle winner at Leopardstown last week.
